param.name: select_process
param.label: Select process
param.option: securityInFailed: Convert raster data from one format to another.
HelloPy: Create a welcome message string.
OTB.MorphologicalMultiScaleDecomposition: Perform a geodesic morphology based image analysis on an input image channel
OTB.Convert: Convert an image to a different format, optionally rescaling the data and/or changing the pixel type.
OTB.PredictRegression: Performs a prediction of the input image according to a regression model file.
OTB.SARPolarMatrixConvert: This applications allows converting classical polarimetric matrices to each other.
OTB.ImageClassifier: Performs a classification of the input image according to a model file.
OTB.SFSTextureExtraction: Computes Structural Feature Set textures on every pixel of the input image selected channel
OTB.VectorDataExtractROI: Perform an extract ROI on the input vector data according to the input image extent
OTB.HyperspectralUnmixing: Estimate abundance maps from an hyperspectral image and a set of endmembers.
OTB.HooverCompareSegmentation: Compare two segmentations with Hoover metrics
OTB.ComputeConfusionMatrix: Computes the confusion matrix of a classification
OTB.ConcatenateImages: Concatenate a list of images of the same size into a single multi-channel one.
OTB.SampleAugmentation: Generates synthetic samples from a sample data file.
OTB.HaralickTextureExtraction: Computes Haralick textural features on the selected channel of the input image
OTB.ConvertSensorToGeoPoint: Sensor to geographic coordinates conversion.
OTB.HomologousPointsExtraction: Compute homologous points between images using keypoints
OTB.DSFuzzyModelEstimation: Estimate feature fuzzy model parameters using 2 vector data (ground truth samples and wrong samples).
OTB.OrthoRectification: This application allows ortho-rectifying optical and radar images from supported sensors.
OTB.BinaryMorphologicalOperation: Performs morphological operations on an input image channel
OTB.BlockMatching: Performs block-matching to estimate pixel-wise disparities between two images.
OTB.KmzExport: Export the input image in a KMZ product.
OTB.ConnectedComponentSegmentation: Connected component segmentation and object based image filtering of the input image according to user-defined criterions.
OTB.TrainImagesClassifier: Train a classifier from multiple pairs of images and training vector data.
OTB.MultivariateAlterationDetector: Change detection by Multivariate Alteration Detector (MAD) algorithm
OTB.ComputePolylineFeatureFromImage: This application computes the chosen descriptors for each studied polyline contained in the input VectorData.
OTB.MultiImageSamplingRate: Compute sampling rate for an input set of images.
OTB.Segmentation: Performs segmentation of an image, and output either a raster or a vector file. In vector mode, large input datasets are supported.
OTB.VectorDataDSValidation: Vector data validation based on the fusion of features using Dempster-Shafer evidence theory framework.
OTB.OGRLayerClassifier: Classify an OGR layer based on a machine learning model and a list of features to consider.
OTB.OSMDownloader: Download vector data from OSM and store it to file
OTB.DisparityMapToElevationMap: Projects a disparity map into a regular elevation map.
OTB.VectorClassifier: Performs a classification of the input vector data according to a model file.
OTB.ObtainUTMZoneFromGeoPoint: UTM zone determination from a geographic point.
OTB.GeneratePlyFile: Generate a 3D Ply file from a DEM and a color image.
OTB.StereoRectificationGridGenerator: Generates two deformation fields to resample in epipolar geometry, a pair of stereo images up to the sensor model precision
OTB.SARDeburst: This application performs deburst of Sentinel1 IW SLC images by removing redundant lines.
OTB.SampleExtraction: Extracts samples values from an image.
OTB.MorphologicalProfilesAnalysis: Performs morphological profiles analysis on an input image channel.
OTB.MeanShiftSmoothing: This application smooths an image using the MeanShift algorithm.
OTB.ConvertCartoToGeoPoint: Convert cartographic coordinates to geographic ones.
OTB.VectorDataTransform: Apply a transform to each vertex of the input VectorData
OTB.FusionOfClassifications: Fuses several classifications maps of the same image on the basis of class labels.
OTB.VectorDataSetField: Set a field in vector data.
OTB.GridBasedImageResampling: Resamples an image according to a resampling grid
OTB.SARPolarSynth: Gives, for each pixel, the power that would have been received by a SAR system with a basis different from the classical (H,V) one (polarimetric synthetis).
OTB.GrayScaleMorphologicalOperation: Performs morphological operations on a grayscale input image
OTB.ReadImageInfo: Get information about the image
OTB.LSMSVectorization: This application performs the fourth step of the exact Large-Scale Mean-Shift segmentation workflow [1].
OTB.FineRegistration: Estimate disparity map between two images.
OTB.GenerateRPCSensorModel: Generate a RPC sensor model from a list of Ground Control Points.
OTB.DomainTransform: Domain Transform application for wavelet and fourier
OTB.RefineSensorModel: Perform least-square fit of a sensor model to a set of tie points
OTB.ComputeImagesStatistics: Computes global mean and standard deviation for each band from a set of images and optionally saves the results in an XML file.
OTB.BandMath: Outputs a monoband image which is the result of a mathematical operation on several multi-band images.
OTB.RigidTransformResample: Resample an image with a rigid transform

OTB.SARCalibration: Perform radiometric calibration of SAR images. Following sensors are supported: TerraSAR-X, Sentinel1 and Radarsat-2.Both Single Look Complex(SLC) and detected products are supported as input.
OTB.Smoothing: Apply a smoothing filter to an image
OTB.TileFusion: Fusion of an image made of several tile files.
OTB.ColorMapping: Maps an input label image to 8-bits RGB using look-up tables.
OTB.Superimpose: Using available image metadata, project one image onto another one
OTB.ClassificationMapRegularization: Filters the input labeled image using Majority Voting in a ball shaped neighbordhood.
OTB.DynamicConvert: Change the pixel type and rescale the image's dynamic
OTB.Rescale: Rescale the image between two given values.
OTB.Quicklook: Generates a subsampled version of an image extract
OTB.ExtractROI: Extract a ROI defined by the user.
OTB.PolygonClassStatistics: Computes statistics on a training polygon set.
OTB.DEMConvert: Converts a geo-referenced DEM image into a general raster file compatible with OTB DEM handling.
OTB.MultiResolutionPyramid: Build a multi-resolution pyramid of the image.
OTB.LSMSSegmentation: This application performs the second step of the exact Large-Scale Mean-Shift segmentation workflow (LSMS) [1].
OTB.Despeckle: Perform speckle noise reduction on SAR image.
OTB.TrainVectorClassifier: Train a classifier based on labeled geometries and a list of features to consider.
OTB.SampleSelection: Selects samples from a training vector data set.
OTB.VertexComponentAnalysis: Given a set of mixed spectral vectors, estimatereference substances also known as endmembers using the VertexComponent Analysis algorithm.
OTB.SplitImage: Split a N multiband image into N images.
OTB.DownloadSRTMTiles: Download or list SRTM tiles
OTB.ComputeOGRLayersFeaturesStatistics: Compute statistics of the features in a set of OGR Layers
OTB.LSMSSmallRegionsMerging: This application performs the third (optional) step of the exact Large-Scale Mean-Shift segmentation workflow [1].
OTB.PixelValue: Get the value of a pixel.
OTB.MorphologicalClassification: Performs morphological convex, concave and flat classification on an input image channel
OTB.TrainRegression: Train a classifier from multiple images to perform regression.

OTB.ContrastEnhancement: This application is the implementation of the histogram equalization algorithm. It can be used to enhance contrast in an image or to reduce the dynamic of the image without losing too much contrast. It offers several options as a no data value, a contrast limitation factor, a local version of the algorithm and also a mode to equalize the luminance of the image.
OTB.SARDecompositions: From one-band complex images (each one related to an element of the Sinclair matrix), returns the selected decomposition.
OTB.EdgeExtraction: This application computes edge features on every pixel of the input image selected channel
OTB.VectorDataReprojection: Reproject a vector data using support image projection reference, or a user specified map projection
OTB.ComputeModulusAndPhase: This application computes the modulus and the phase of a complex SAR image.
OTB.LineSegmentDetection: Detect line segments in raster
OTB.LocalStatisticExtraction: Computes local statistical moments on every pixel in the selected channel of the input image

param.name: a
param.label: a
param.help: The name to display in the welcome message.

param.name: S
param.label: S
param.help: The name to display in the hello message

param.name: S
param.label: S
param.help: The name to display in the hello message

param.name: in
param.label: in
param.help: The input image to be classified.

param.name: outconvex
param.label: outconvex
param.help: The output convex image with N bands

param.name: outconcave
param.label: outconcave
param.help: The output concave concave with N bands

param.name: outleveling
param.label: outleveling
param.help: The output leveling image with N bands

param.name: channel
param.label: channel
param.help: The selected channel index for input image

param.name: structype
param.label: structype
param.help: Choice of the structuring element type

param.name: radius
param.label: radius
param.help: Initial radius of the structuring element (in pixels)

param.name: step
param.label: step
param.help: Radius step along the profile (in pixels)

param.name: levels
param.label: levels
param.help: Number of levels use for multi scale

param.name: mask
param.label: mask
param.help: Optional mask to indicate which pixels are valid for computing the histogram quantiles. Only pixels where the mask is less than 0.5 will contribute to the histogram. The mask must have the same dimensions as the input image.

param.name: hcp.high
param.label: hcp.high
param.help: Quantiles to cut from histogram high values before computing min/max rescaling (in percent, 2 by default)

param.name: hcp.low
param.label: hcp.low
param.help: Quantiles to cut from histogram low values before computing min/max rescaling (in percent, 2 by default)

param.name: channels
param.label: channels
param.help: It's possible to select the channels of the output image. There are 3 modes, the available choices are:

param.name: mask
param.label: mask
param.help: The mask allow restricting classification of the input image to the area where mask pixel values are greater than 0.

param.name: model
param.label: model
param.help: A regression model file (produced by TrainRegression application).

param.name: imstat
param.label: imstat
param.help: A XML file containing mean and standard deviation to center and reduce samples before prediction (produced by ComputeImagesStatistics application). If this file containsone more band than the sample size, the last stat of last band will beapplied to expand the output predicted value

param.name: mask
param.label: mask
param.help: The mask allows restricting classification of the input image to the area where mask pixel values are greater than 0.

param.name: model
param.label: model
param.help: A model file (produced by TrainImagesClassifier application, maximal class label = 65535).

param.name: imstat
param.label: imstat
param.help: A XML file containing mean and standard deviation to center and reduce samples before classification (produced by ComputeImagesStatistics application).

param.name: nodatalabel
param.label: nodatalabel
param.help: By default, hidden pixels will have the assigned label 0 in the output image. It's possible to define the label mask by another value, but be careful to not take a label from another class (max. 65535).

param.name: confmap
param.label: confmap
param.help: Confidence map of the produced classification. The confidence index depends on the model : - LibSVM : difference between the two highest probabilities (needs a model with probability estimates, so that classes probabilities can be computed for each sample) - OpenCV * Boost : sum of votes * DecisionTree : (not supported) * GradientBoostedTree : (not supported) * KNearestNeighbors : number of neighbors with the same label * NeuralNetwork : difference between the two highest responses * NormalBayes : (not supported) * RandomForest : Confidence (proportion of votes for the majority class). Margin (normalized difference of the votes of the 2 majority classes) is not available for now. * SVM : distance to margin (only works for 2-class models)

param.name: usenan
param.label: usenan
param.help: If active, the application will consider NaN as no-data values as well

param.name: mode
param.label: mode
param.help: Allows choosing between different no-data handling options

param.name: mode.buildmask.inv
param.label: mode.buildmask.inv
param.help: Value given in the output mask to pixels that are not no data pixels

param.name: mode.buildmask.outv
param.label: mode.buildmask.outv
param.help: Value given in the output mask to pixels that are no data pixels

param.name: mode.apply.mask
param.label: mode.apply.mask
param.help: Mask to be applied on input image (valid pixels have non null values)

param.name: mode.apply.ndval
param.label: mode.apply.ndval
param.help: No Data value used according to the mask image

param.name: in
param.label: in
param.help: The input image to compute the features on.

param.name: out
param.label: out
param.help: Output image containing the SFS texture features.

param.name: io.in
param.label: io.in
param.help: Support image that specifies the extracted region

param.name: elev.dem
param.label: elev.dem
param.help: This parameter allows selecting a directory containing Digital Elevation Model files. Note that this directory should contain only DEM files. Unexpected behaviour might occurs if other images are found in this directory.

param.name: elev.geoid
param.label: elev.geoid
param.help: Use a geoid grid to get the height above the ellipsoid in case there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles. A version of the geoid can be found on the OTB website(https://gitlab.orfeo-toolbox.org/orfeotoolbox/otb-data/blob/master/Input/DEM/egm96.grd).

param.name: elev.default
param.label: elev.default
param.help: This parameter allows setting the default height above ellipsoid when there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles, and no geoid file has been set. This is also used by some application as an average elevation value.

param.name: out
param.label: out
param.help: The output abundance map. The abundance fraction are stored in a multispectral image where band N corresponds to the fraction of endmembers N in each pixel.

param.name: ie
param.label: ie
param.help: The endmembers (estimated pure pixels) to use for unmixing. Must be stored as a multispectral image, where each pixel is interpreted as an endmember.

param.name: ua
param.label: ua
param.help: The algorithm to use for unmixing

param.name: ingt
param.label: ingt
param.help: A partial ground truth segmentation image.

param.name: bg
param.label: bg
param.help: Label value of the background in the input segmentations

param.name: th
param.label: th
param.help: Overlapping threshold used to find Hoover instances.

param.name: outgt
param.label: outgt
param.help: The colored ground truth output image.

param.name: outms
param.label: outms
param.help: The colored machine segmentation output image.

param.name: format
param.label: format
param.help: Choice of the output format as a contingency table for unsupervised algorithmsor confusion matrix for supervised ones.

param.name: ref.raster.in
param.label: ref.raster.in
param.help: Input image containing the ground truth labels

param.name: ref.raster.nodata
param.label: ref.raster.nodata
param.help: Label to be treated as no data in ref raster.

param.name: ref.vector.in
param.label: ref.vector.in
param.help: Input vector data of the ground truth

param.name: ref.vector.field
param.label: ref.vector.field
param.help: Field name containing the label values

param.name: ref.vector.nodata
param.label: ref.vector.nodata
param.help: Label to be treated as no data in ref vector. Please note that this value is always used in vector mode, to generate default values. Please set it to a value that does not correspond to a class label.

param.name: nodatalabel
param.label: nodatalabel
param.help: Label to be treated as no data in input image

param.name: il
param.label: il
param.help: The list of images to concatenate, must have the same size.

param.name: in
param.label: in
param.help: Vector data file containing samples (OGR format)

param.name: field
param.label: field
param.help: Name of the field carrying the class name in the input vectors.

param.name: layer
param.label: layer
param.help: Layer index to read in the input vector file.

param.name: label
param.label: label
param.help: Label of the class of the input file for which new samples will be generated.

param.name: samples
param.label: samples
param.help: Number of synthetic samples that will be generated.

param.name: exclude
param.label: exclude
param.help: List of field names in the input vector data that will not be generated in the output file.

param.name: strategy.jitter.stdfactor
param.label: strategy.jitter.stdfactor
param.help: The noise added to the input samples will have the standard deviation of the input features divided by the value of this parameter.

param.name: strategy.smote.neighbors
param.label: strategy.smote.neighbors
param.help: Number of nearest neighbors to be used in the SMOTE algorithm

param.name: seed
param.label: seed
param.help: Set specific seed. with integer value.

param.name: in
param.label: in
param.help: The input image to compute the features on.

param.name: step
param.label: step
param.help: Step (in pixels) to compute output texture values. The first computed pixel position is shifted by (step-1)/2 in both directions.

param.name: out
param.label: out
param.help: Output image containing the selected texture features.

param.name: input.idx
param.label: input.idx
param.help: X coordinate of the point to transform.

param.name: input.idy
param.label: input.idy
param.help: Y coordinate of the point to transform.

param.name: band1
param.label: band1
param.help: Index of the band from input image 1 to use for keypoints extraction

param.name: band2
param.label: band2
param.help: Index of the band from input image 1 to use for keypoints extraction

param.name: algorithm
param.label: algorithm
param.help: Choice of the detection algorithm to use

param.name: backmatching
param.label: backmatching
param.help: If set to true, matches should be consistent in both ways.

param.name: mode.geobins.binsize
param.label: mode.geobins.binsize
param.help: Radius of the spatial bin in pixels

param.name: mode.geobins.binsizey
param.label: mode.geobins.binsizey
param.help: Radius of the spatial bin in pixels (y direction). If not set, the mode.geobins.binsize value is used.

param.name: mode.geobins.binstepy
param.label: mode.geobins.binstepy
param.help: Steps between bins in pixels (y direction). If not set, the mode.geobins.binstep value is used.

param.name: mode.geobins.margin
param.label: mode.geobins.margin
param.help: Margin from image border to start/end bins (in pixels)

param.name: precision
param.label: precision
param.help: Estimated precision of the colocalisation function in pixels

param.name: mfilter
param.label: mfilter
param.help: If enabled, this option allows one to filter matches according to colocalisation from sensor or geographical information, using the given tolerancy expressed in pixels

param.name: elev.dem
param.label: elev.dem
param.help: This parameter allows selecting a directory containing Digital Elevation Model files. Note that this directory should contain only DEM files. Unexpected behaviour might occurs if other images are found in this directory.

param.name: elev.geoid
param.label: elev.geoid
param.help: Use a geoid grid to get the height above the ellipsoid in case there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles. A version of the geoid can be found on the OTB website(https://gitlab.orfeo-toolbox.org/orfeotoolbox/otb-data/blob/master/Input/DEM/egm96.grd).

param.name: elev.default
param.label: elev.default
param.help: This parameter allows setting the default height above ellipsoid when there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles, and no geoid file has been set. This is also used by some application as an average elevation value.

param.name: psin
param.label: psin
param.help: Ground truth vector data for positive samples

param.name: nsin
param.label: nsin
param.help: Ground truth vector data for negative samples

param.name: belsup
param.label: belsup
param.help: Dempster Shafer study hypothesis to compute belief

param.name: plasup
param.label: plasup
param.help: Dempster Shafer study hypothesis to compute plausibility

param.name: wgt
param.label: wgt
param.help: Coefficient between 0 and 1 to promote undetection or false detections (default 0.5)

param.name: initmod
param.label: initmod
param.help: Initialization model (xml file) to be used. If the xml initialization model is set, the descriptor list is not used (specified using the option -desclist)

param.name: desclist
param.label: desclist
param.help: List of the descriptors to be used in the model (must be specified to perform an automatic initialization)

param.name: map
param.label: map
param.help: Defines the map projection to be used.

param.name: map.utm.zone
param.label: map.utm.zone
param.help: The zone number ranges from 1 to 60 and allows defining the transverse mercator projection (along with the hemisphere)

param.name: map.utm.northhem
param.label: map.utm.northhem
param.help: The transverse mercator projections are defined by their zone number as well as the hemisphere. Activate this parameter if your image is in the northern hemisphere.

param.name: map.epsg.code
param.label: map.epsg.code
param.help: See www.spatialreference.org to find which EPSG code is associated to your projection

param.name: outputs.ulx
param.label: outputs.ulx
param.help: Cartographic X coordinate of upper-left corner (meters for cartographic projections, degrees for geographic ones)

param.name: outputs.uly
param.label: outputs.uly
param.help: Cartographic Y coordinate of the upper-left corner (meters for cartographic projections, degrees for geographic ones)

param.name: outputs.sizex
param.label: outputs.sizex
param.help: Size of projected image along X (in pixels)

param.name: outputs.sizey
param.label: outputs.sizey
param.help: Size of projected image along Y (in pixels)

param.name: outputs.spacingx
param.label: outputs.spacingx
param.help: Size of each pixel along X axis (meters for cartographic projections, degrees for geographic ones)

param.name: outputs.spacingy
param.label: outputs.spacingy
param.help: Size of each pixel along Y axis (meters for cartographic projections, degrees for geographic ones)

param.name: outputs.lrx
param.label: outputs.lrx
param.help: Cartographic X coordinate of the lower-right corner (meters for cartographic projections, degrees for geographic ones)

param.name: outputs.lry
param.label: outputs.lry
param.help: Cartographic Y coordinate of the lower-right corner (meters for cartographic projections, degrees for geographic ones)

param.name: outputs.ortho
param.label: outputs.ortho
param.help: A model ortho-image that can be used to compute size, origin and spacing of the output

param.name: outputs.isotropic
param.label: outputs.isotropic
param.help: Default spacing (pixel size) values are estimated from the sensor modeling of the image. It can therefore result in a non-isotropic spacing. This option allows you to force default values to be isotropic (in this case, the minimum of spacing in both direction is applied. Values overridden by user are not affected by this option.

param.name: outputs.default
param.label: outputs.default
param.help: Default value to write when outside of input image.

param.name: elev.dem
param.label: elev.dem
param.help: This parameter allows selecting a directory containing Digital Elevation Model files. Note that this directory should contain only DEM files. Unexpected behaviour might occurs if other images are found in this directory.

param.name: elev.geoid
param.label: elev.geoid
param.help: Use a geoid grid to get the height above the ellipsoid in case there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles. A version of the geoid can be found on the OTB website(https://gitlab.orfeo-toolbox.org/orfeotoolbox/otb-data/blob/master/Input/DEM/egm96.grd).

param.name: elev.default
param.label: elev.default
param.help: This parameter allows setting the default height above ellipsoid when there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles, and no geoid file has been set. This is also used by some application as an average elevation value.

param.name: interpolator
param.label: interpolator
param.help: This group of parameters allows one to define how the input image will be interpolated during resampling.

param.name: interpolator.bco.radius
param.label: interpolator.bco.radius
param.help: Enabling RPC modeling allows one to speed-up SPOT5 ortho-rectification. Value is the number of control points per axis for RPC estimation

param.name: opt.ram
param.label: opt.ram
param.help: This allows setting the maximum amount of RAM available for processing. As the writing task is time consuming, it is better to write large pieces of data, which can be achieved by increasing this parameter (pay attention to your system capabilities)

param.name: opt.gridspacing
param.label: opt.gridspacing
param.help: Resampling is done according to a coordinate mapping deformation grid, whose pixel size is set by this parameter, and expressed in the coordinate system of the output image The closer to the output spacing this parameter is, the more precise will be the ortho-rectified image,but increasing this parameter will reduce processing time.

param.name: in
param.label: in
param.help: The input image to be filtered.

param.name: structype
param.label: structype
param.help: Choice of the structuring element type

param.name: structype.ball.xradius
param.label: structype.ball.xradius
param.help: The structuring element radius along the X axis.

param.name: structype.ball.yradius
param.label: structype.ball.yradius
param.help: The structuring element radius along the y axis.

param.name: filter.dilate.foreval
param.label: filter.dilate.foreval
param.help: Set the foreground value, default is 1.0.

param.name: filter.dilate.backval
param.label: filter.dilate.backval
param.help: Set the background value, default is 0.0.

param.name: filter.erode.foreval
param.label: filter.erode.foreval
param.help: Set the foreground value, default is 1.0.

param.name: filter.erode.backval
param.label: filter.erode.backval
param.help: Set the background value, default is 0.0.

param.name: filter.opening.foreval
param.label: filter.opening.foreval
param.help: Set the foreground value, default is 1.0.

param.name: filter.opening.backval
param.label: filter.opening.backval
param.help: Set the background value, default is 0.0.

param.name: filter.closing.foreval
param.label: filter.closing.foreval
param.help: Set the foreground value, default is 1.0.

param.name: io.inleft
param.label: io.inleft
param.help: The left input image (reference).It should have the same size and same physical space as the right input. This image can be generated by GridBasedImageResampling

param.name: io.inright
param.label: io.inright
param.help: The right input (secondary).It should have the same size and same physical space as the left input. This image can be generated by GridBasedImageResampling

param.name: io.out
param.label: io.out
param.help: An image containing the estimated disparities as well as the metric values if the option is used. If no metric is output and no sub-pixel interpolation is done, pixel type canbe a signed integer. In the other cases, floating point pixel is advised.

param.name: io.outmask
param.label: io.outmask
param.help: An output mask image corresponding to all citerions (see masking parameters). Only required if variance threshold or nodata criterions are set. Output pixel type is unsigned 8bit by default.

param.name: io.outmetric
param.label: io.outmetric
param.help: If enabled, the output image will have a third component with metric optimal values

param.name: mask.inleft
param.label: mask.inleft
param.help: This parameter allows providing a custom mask for the left image. Block matching will be only perform on pixels inside the mask (non-zero values).

param.name: mask.inright
param.label: mask.inright
param.help: This parameter allows providing a custom mask for the right image. Block matching will be perform only on pixels inside the mask (non-zero values).

param.name: mask.nodata
param.label: mask.nodata
param.help: This parameter allows discarding pixels whose value is equal to the user-defined no-data value.

param.name: mask.variancet
param.label: mask.variancet
param.help: This parameter allows discarding pixels whose local variance is too small (the size of the neighborhood is given by the radius parameter)

param.name: bm.metric
param.label: bm.metric
param.help: Metric to evaluate matching between two local windows.

param.name: bm.metric.lp.p
param.label: bm.metric.lp.p
param.help: Value of the p parameter in Lp pseudo-norm (must be positive).

param.name: bm.radius
param.label: bm.radius
param.help: The radius (in pixels) of blocks in Block-Matching

param.name: bm.minhd
param.label: bm.minhd
param.help: Minimum horizontal disparity to explore (can be negative)

param.name: bm.maxhd
param.label: bm.maxhd
param.help: Maximum horizontal disparity to explore (can be negative)

param.name: bm.minvd
param.label: bm.minvd
param.help: Minimum vertical disparity to explore (can be negative)

param.name: bm.maxvd
param.label: bm.maxvd
param.help: Maximum vertical disparity to explore (can be negative)

param.name: bm.step
param.label: bm.step
param.help: Location step between computed disparities. Disparities will be computed every 'step' pixels in the left image (step for both rows and columns). For instance, a value of 1 corresponds to the classic dense disparity map.

param.name: bm.startx
param.label: bm.startx
param.help: X start index of the subsampled grid (wrt the input image grid). See parameter bm.step

param.name: bm.starty
param.label: bm.starty
param.help: Y start index of the subsampled grid (wrt the input image grid). See parameter bm.step

param.name: bm.medianfilter.incoherence
param.label: bm.medianfilter.incoherence
param.help: Incoherence threshold between original and filtered disparity

param.name: bm.initdisp.uniform.hdisp
param.label: bm.initdisp.uniform.hdisp
param.help: Value of the uniform horizontal disparity initial estimate (in pixels)

param.name: bm.initdisp.uniform.vdisp
param.label: bm.initdisp.uniform.vdisp
param.help: Value of the uniform vertical disparity initial estimate (in pixels)

param.name: bm.initdisp.uniform.hrad
param.label: bm.initdisp.uniform.hrad
param.help: Horizontal exploration radius around the initial disparity estimate (in pixels)

param.name: bm.initdisp.uniform.vrad
param.label: bm.initdisp.uniform.vrad
param.help: Vertical exploration radius around the initial disparity estimate (in pixels)

param.name: bm.initdisp.maps.hmap
param.label: bm.initdisp.maps.hmap
param.help: Map of the initial horizontal disparities

param.name: bm.initdisp.maps.vmap
param.label: bm.initdisp.maps.vmap
param.help: Map of the initial vertical disparities

param.name: bm.initdisp.maps.hrad
param.label: bm.initdisp.maps.hrad
param.help: Horizontal exploration radius around the initial disparity estimate (in pixels)

param.name: bm.initdisp.maps.vrad
param.label: bm.initdisp.maps.vrad
param.help: Vertical exploration radius around the initial disparity estimate (in pixels)

param.name: tilesize
param.label: tilesize
param.help: Size of the tiles in the kmz product, in number of pixels (default = 512).

param.name: logo
param.label: logo
param.help: Path to the image logo to add to the KMZ product.

param.name: legend
param.label: legend
param.help: Path to the image legend to add to the KMZ product.

param.name: elev.dem
param.label: elev.dem
param.help: This parameter allows selecting a directory containing Digital Elevation Model files. Note that this directory should contain only DEM files. Unexpected behaviour might occurs if other images are found in this directory.

param.name: elev.geoid
param.label: elev.geoid
param.help: Use a geoid grid to get the height above the ellipsoid in case there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles. A version of the geoid can be found on the OTB website(https://gitlab.orfeo-toolbox.org/orfeotoolbox/otb-data/blob/master/Input/DEM/egm96.grd).

param.name: elev.default
param.label: elev.default
param.help: This parameter allows setting the default height above ellipsoid when there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles, and no geoid file has been set. This is also used by some application as an average elevation value.

param.name: mask
param.label: mask
param.help: Mask mathematical expression (only if support image is given)

param.name: expr
param.label: expr
param.help: Formula used for connected component segmentation

param.name: elev.dem
param.label: elev.dem
param.help: This parameter allows selecting a directory containing Digital Elevation Model files. Note that this directory should contain only DEM files. Unexpected behaviour might occurs if other images are found in this directory.

param.name: elev.geoid
param.label: elev.geoid
param.help: Use a geoid grid to get the height above the ellipsoid in case there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles. A version of the geoid can be found on the OTB website(https://gitlab.orfeo-toolbox.org/orfeotoolbox/otb-data/blob/master/Input/DEM/egm96.grd).

param.name: elev.default
param.label: elev.default
param.help: This parameter allows setting the default height above ellipsoid when there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles, and no geoid file has been set. This is also used by some application as an average elevation value.

param.name: io.vd
param.label: io.vd
param.help: A list of vector data to select the training samples.

param.name: io.valid
param.label: io.valid
param.help: A list of vector data to select the validation samples.

param.name: io.imstat
param.label: io.imstat
param.help: XML file containing mean and variance of each feature.

param.name: cleanup
param.label: cleanup
param.help: If activated, the application will try to clean all temporary files it created

param.name: sample.mt
param.label: sample.mt
param.help: Maximum size per class (in pixels) of the training sample list (default = 1000) (no limit = -1). If equal to -1, then the maximal size of the available training sample list per class will be equal to the surface area of the smallest class multiplied by the training sample ratio.

param.name: sample.mv
param.label: sample.mv
param.help: Maximum size per class (in pixels) of the validation sample list (default = 1000) (no limit = -1). If equal to -1, then the maximal size of the available validation sample list per class will be equal to the surface area of the smallest class multiplied by the validation sample ratio.

param.name: sample.bm
param.label: sample.bm
param.help: Bound the number of samples for each class by the number of available samples by the smaller class. Proportions between training and validation are respected. Default is true (=1).

param.name: sample.vtr
param.label: sample.vtr
param.help: Ratio between training and validation samples (0.0 = all training, 1.0 = all validation) (default = 0.5).

param.name: sample.vfn
param.label: sample.vfn
param.help: Field containing the class id for supervision. The values in this field shall be cast into integers.

param.name: elev.dem
param.label: elev.dem
param.help: This parameter allows selecting a directory containing Digital Elevation Model files. Note that this directory should contain only DEM files. Unexpected behaviour might occurs if other images are found in this directory.

param.name: elev.geoid
param.label: elev.geoid
param.help: Use a geoid grid to get the height above the ellipsoid in case there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles. A version of the geoid can be found on the OTB website(https://gitlab.orfeo-toolbox.org/orfeotoolbox/otb-data/blob/master/Input/DEM/egm96.grd).

param.name: elev.default
param.label: elev.default
param.help: This parameter allows setting the default height above ellipsoid when there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles, and no geoid file has been set. This is also used by some application as an average elevation value.

param.name: classifier
param.label: classifier
param.help: Choice of the classifier to use for the training.

param.name: classifier.libsvm.c
param.label: classifier.libsvm.c
param.help: SVM models have a cost parameter C (1 by default) to control the trade-off between training errors and forcing rigid margins.

param.name: classifier.libsvm.nu
param.label: classifier.libsvm.nu
param.help: Cost parameter Nu, in the range 0..1, the larger the value, the smoother the decision.

param.name: classifier.boost.r
param.label: classifier.boost.r
param.help: A threshold between 0 and 1 used to save computational time. Samples with summary weight <= (1 - weight_trim_rate) do not participate in the next iteration of training. Set this parameter to 0 to turn off this functionality.

param.name: classifier.dt.max
param.label: classifier.dt.max
param.help: The training algorithm attempts to split each node while its depth is smaller than the maximum possible depth of the tree. The actual depth may be smaller if the other termination criteria are met, and/or if the tree is pruned.

param.name: classifier.dt.min
param.label: classifier.dt.min
param.help: If the number of samples in a node is smaller than this parameter, then this node will not be split.

param.name: classifier.dt.ra
param.label: classifier.dt.ra
param.help: If all absolute differences between an estimated value in a node and the values of the train samples in this node are smaller than this regression accuracy parameter, then the node will not be split further.

param.name: classifier.dt.cat
param.label: classifier.dt.cat
param.help: Cluster possible values of a categorical variable into K <= cat clusters to find a suboptimal split.

param.name: classifier.dt.f
param.label: classifier.dt.f
param.help: If cv_folds > 1, then it prunes a tree with K-fold cross-validation where K is equal to cv_folds.

param.name: classifier.dt.r
param.label: classifier.dt.r
param.help: If true, then a pruning will be harsher. This will make a tree more compact and more resistant to the training data noise but a bit less accurate.

param.name: classifier.dt.t
param.label: classifier.dt.t
param.help: If true, then pruned branches are physically removed from the tree.

param.name: classifier.ann.t
param.label: classifier.ann.t
param.help: Type of training method for the multilayer perceptron (MLP) neural network.

param.name: classifier.ann.sizes
param.label: classifier.ann.sizes
param.help: The number of neurons in each intermediate layer (excluding input and output layers).

param.name: classifier.ann.f
param.label: classifier.ann.f
param.help: This function determine whether the output of the node is positive or not depending on the output of the transfert function.

param.name: classifier.ann.a
param.label: classifier.ann.a
param.help: Alpha parameter of the activation function (used only with sigmoid and gaussian functions).

param.name: classifier.ann.b
param.label: classifier.ann.b
param.help: Beta parameter of the activation function (used only with sigmoid and gaussian functions).

param.name: classifier.ann.bpdw
param.label: classifier.ann.bpdw
param.help: Strength of the weight gradient term in the BACKPROP method. The recommended value is about 0.1.

param.name: classifier.ann.bpms
param.label: classifier.ann.bpms
param.help: Strength of the momentum term (the difference between weights on the 2 previous iterations). This parameter provides some inertia to smooth the random fluctuations of the weights. It can vary from 0 (the feature is disabled) to 1 and beyond. The value 0.1 or so is good enough.

param.name: classifier.ann.rdw
param.label: classifier.ann.rdw
param.help: Initial value Delta_0 of update-values Delta_

param.name: classifier.ann.eps
param.label: classifier.ann.eps
param.help: Epsilon value used in the Termination criteria.

param.name: classifier.ann.iter
param.label: classifier.ann.iter
param.help: Maximum number of iterations used in the Termination criteria.

param.name: classifier.rf.max
param.label: classifier.rf.max
param.help: The depth of the tree. A low value will likely underfit and conversely a high value will likely overfit. The optimal value can be obtained using cross validation or other suitable methods.

param.name: classifier.rf.min
param.label: classifier.rf.min
param.help: If the number of samples in a node is smaller than this parameter, then the node will not be split. A reasonable value is a small percentage of the total data e.g. 1 percent.

param.name: classifier.rf.ra
param.label: classifier.rf.ra
param.help: If all absolute differences between an estimated value in a node and the values of the train samples in this node are smaller than this regression accuracy parameter, then the node will not be split.

param.name: classifier.rf.cat
param.label: classifier.rf.cat
param.help: Cluster possible values of a categorical variable into K <= cat clusters to find a suboptimal split.

param.name: classifier.rf.var
param.label: classifier.rf.var
param.help: The size of the subset of features, randomly selected at each tree node, that are used to find the best split(s). If you set it to 0, then the size will be set to the square root of the total number of features.

param.name: classifier.rf.nbtrees
param.label: classifier.rf.nbtrees
param.help: The maximum number of trees in the forest. Typically, the more trees you have, the better the accuracy. However, the improvement in accuracy generally diminishes and reaches an asymptote for a certain number of trees. Also to keep in mind, increasing the number of trees increases the prediction time linearly.

param.name: classifier.knn.k
param.label: classifier.knn.k
param.help: The number of neighbors to use.

param.name: rand
param.label: rand
param.help: Set specific seed. with integer value.

param.name: in1
param.label: in1
param.help: Multiband image of the scene before perturbations

param.name: in2
param.label: in2
param.help: Mutliband image of the scene after perturbations.

param.name: out
param.label: out
param.help: Multiband image containing change maps. Each map will be in the range [-1,1], so a floating point output type is advised.

param.name: in
param.label: in
param.help: An image to compute the descriptors on.

param.name: vd
param.label: vd
param.help: Vector data containing the polylines where the features will be computed.

param.name: elev.dem
param.label: elev.dem
param.help: This parameter allows selecting a directory containing Digital Elevation Model files. Note that this directory should contain only DEM files. Unexpected behaviour might occurs if other images are found in this directory.

param.name: elev.geoid
param.label: elev.geoid
param.help: Use a geoid grid to get the height above the ellipsoid in case there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles. A version of the geoid can be found on the OTB website(https://gitlab.orfeo-toolbox.org/orfeotoolbox/otb-data/blob/master/Input/DEM/egm96.grd).

param.name: elev.default
param.label: elev.default
param.help: This parameter allows setting the default height above ellipsoid when there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles, and no geoid file has been set. This is also used by some application as an average elevation value.

param.name: expr
param.label: expr
param.help: The feature formula (b1 < 0.3) where b1 is the standard name of input image first band

param.name: field
param.label: field
param.help: The field name corresponding to the feature codename (NONDVI, ROADSA...)

param.name: strategy.byclass.in
param.label: strategy.byclass.in
param.help: Number of samples for all classes.In the case of the custom multi-image mode, several values can be given for each image.

param.name: strategy.percent.p
param.label: strategy.percent.p
param.help: The percentage(s) to use In the case of the custom multi-image mode, several values can be given for each image.

param.name: strategy.total.v
param.label: strategy.total.v
param.help: The number of samples to generateIn the case of the custom multi-image mode, several values can be given for each image.

param.name: filter
param.label: filter
param.help: Choice of segmentation algorithm (mean-shift by default)

param.name: filter.meanshift.ranger
param.label: filter.meanshift.ranger
param.help: Range radius defining the radius (expressed in radiometry unit) in the multispectral space.

param.name: filter.meanshift.thres
param.label: filter.meanshift.thres
param.help: Algorithm iterative scheme will stop if mean-shift vector is below this threshold or if iteration number reached maximum number of iterations.

param.name: filter.meanshift.maxiter
param.label: filter.meanshift.maxiter
param.help: Algorithm iterative scheme will stop if convergence hasn't been reached after the maximum number of iterations.

param.name: filter.meanshift.minsize
param.label: filter.meanshift.minsize
param.help: Minimum size of a region (in pixel unit) in segmentation. Smaller clusters will be merged to the neighboring cluster with the closest radiometry. If set to 0 no pruning is done.

param.name: filter.cc.expr
param.label: filter.cc.expr
param.help: User defined connection condition, written as a mathematical expression. Available variables are p(i)b(i), intensity_p(i) and distance (example of expression : distance < 10 )

param.name: filter.watershed.threshold
param.label: filter.watershed.threshold
param.help: Depth threshold Units in percentage of the maximum depth in the image.

param.name: filter.watershed.level
param.label: filter.watershed.level
param.help: flood level for generating the merge tree from the initial segmentation (between 0 and 1)

param.name: filter.mprofiles.start
param.label: filter.mprofiles.start
param.help: Initial radius of the structuring element (in pixels)

param.name: filter.mprofiles.step
param.label: filter.mprofiles.step
param.help: Radius step along the profile (in pixels)

param.name: filter.mprofiles.sigma
param.label: filter.mprofiles.sigma
param.help: Profiles values under the threshold will be ignored.

param.name: mode
param.label: mode
param.help: Choice of processing mode, either raster or large-scale.

param.name: mode.vector.outmode
param.label: mode.vector.outmode
param.help: This allows one to set the writing behaviour for the output vector file. Please note that the actual behaviour depends on the file format.

param.name: mode.vector.inmask
param.label: mode.vector.inmask
param.help: Only pixels whose mask value is strictly positive will be segmented.

param.name: mode.vector.stitch
param.label: mode.vector.stitch
param.help: Scan polygons on each side of tiles and stitch polygons which connect by more than one pixel.

param.name: mode.vector.minsize
param.label: mode.vector.minsize
param.help: Objects whose size is below the minimum object size (area in pixels) will be ignored during vectorization.

param.name: mode.vector.simplify
param.label: mode.vector.simplify
param.help: Simplify polygons according to a given tolerance (in pixel). This option allows reducing the size of the output file or database.

param.name: mode.vector.layername
param.label: mode.vector.layername
param.help: Name of the layer in the vector file or database (default is Layer).

param.name: mode.vector.fieldname
param.label: mode.vector.fieldname
param.help: Name of the field holding the geometry index in the output vector file or database.

param.name: mode.vector.tilesize
param.label: mode.vector.tilesize
param.help: User defined tiles size for tile-based segmentation. Optimal tile size is selected according to available RAM if null.

param.name: mode.vector.startlabel
param.label: mode.vector.startlabel
param.help: Starting value of the geometry index field

param.name: mode.vector.ogroptions
param.label: mode.vector.ogroptions
param.help: A list of layer creation options in the form KEY=VALUE that will be passed directly to OGR without any validity checking. Options may depend on the file format, and can be found in OGR documentation.

param.name: belsup
param.label: belsup
param.help: Dempster Shafer study hypothesis to compute belief

param.name: plasup
param.label: plasup
param.help: Dempster Shafer study hypothesis to compute plausibility

param.name: instats
param.label: instats
param.help: XML file containing mean and variance of each feature.

param.name: support
param.label: support
param.help: Image used to derive the spatial extent to be requested from OSM server (the bounding box of the extent is used). Be aware that a request with a large extent may be rejected by the server.

param.name: key
param.label: key
param.help: OSM tag key to extract (highway, building...). It defines a category to select features.

param.name: value
param.label: value
param.help: OSM tag value to extract (motorway, footway...). It defines the type of feature to select inside a category.

param.name: elev.dem
param.label: elev.dem
param.help: This parameter allows selecting a directory containing Digital Elevation Model files. Note that this directory should contain only DEM files. Unexpected behaviour might occurs if other images are found in this directory.

param.name: elev.geoid
param.label: elev.geoid
param.help: Use a geoid grid to get the height above the ellipsoid in case there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles. A version of the geoid can be found on the OTB website(https://gitlab.orfeo-toolbox.org/orfeotoolbox/otb-data/blob/master/Input/DEM/egm96.grd).

param.name: elev.default
param.label: elev.default
param.help: This parameter allows setting the default height above ellipsoid when there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles, and no geoid file has been set. This is also used by some application as an average elevation value.

param.name: printclasses
param.label: printclasses
param.help: Print the key/value classes available for the selected support image. If enabled, the OSM tag Key (-key) and the output (-out) become optional

param.name: io.in
param.label: io.in
param.help: The input disparity map (horizontal disparity in first band, vertical in second). This map can be computed by BlockMatching application.

param.name: io.left
param.label: io.left
param.help: Left image in original (sensor) geometry. Only the geometric model of this image will be used, not the pixel values.

param.name: io.right
param.label: io.right
param.help: Right image in original (sensor) geometry. Only the geometric model of this image will be used, not the pixel values.

param.name: io.lgrid
param.label: io.lgrid
param.help: Left epipolar grid (deformation grid between left sensor et disparity spaces)

param.name: io.rgrid
param.label: io.rgrid
param.help: Right epipolar grid (deformation grid between right sensor et disparity spaces)

param.name: io.out
param.label: io.out
param.help: Output elevation map in ground projection. Elevation values are in meters. Floating point pixel type are expected.

param.name: io.mask
param.label: io.mask
param.help: Masked disparity pixels won't be projected (mask values equal to zero)

param.name: step
param.label: step
param.help: Spacing of the output elevation map (in meters)

param.name: elev.dem
param.label: elev.dem
param.help: This parameter allows selecting a directory containing Digital Elevation Model files. Note that this directory should contain only DEM files. Unexpected behaviour might occurs if other images are found in this directory.

param.name: elev.geoid
param.label: elev.geoid
param.help: Use a geoid grid to get the height above the ellipsoid in case there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles. A version of the geoid can be found on the OTB website(https://gitlab.orfeo-toolbox.org/orfeotoolbox/otb-data/blob/master/Input/DEM/egm96.grd).

param.name: elev.default
param.label: elev.default
param.help: This parameter allows setting the default height above ellipsoid when there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles, and no geoid file has been set. This is also used by some application as an average elevation value.

param.name: in
param.label: in
param.help: The input vector data file to classify.

param.name: instat
param.label: instat
param.help: A XML file containing mean and standard deviation to centerand reduce samples before classification, produced by ComputeImagesStatistics application.

param.name: model
param.label: model
param.help: Model file produced by TrainVectorClassifier application.

param.name: cfield
param.label: cfield
param.help: Field containing the predicted class.Only geometries with this field available will be taken into account.The field is added either in the input file (if 'out' off) or in the output file.Caution, the 'cfield' must not exist in the input file if you are updating the file.

param.name: feat
param.label: feat
param.help: List of field names in the input vector data used as features for training. Put the same field names as the TrainVectorClassifier application.

param.name: confmap
param.label: confmap
param.help: Confidence map of the produced classification. The confidence index depends on the model : - LibSVM : difference between the two highest probabilities (needs a model with probability estimates, so that classes probabilities can be computed for each sample) - OpenCV * Boost : sum of votes * DecisionTree : (not supported) * GradientBoostedTree : (not supported) * KNearestNeighbors : number of neighbors with the same label * NeuralNetwork : difference between the two highest responses * NormalBayes : (not supported) * RandomForest : Confidence (proportion of votes for the majority class). Margin (normalized difference of the votes of the 2 majority classes) is not available for now. * SVM : distance to margin (only works for 2-class models).

param.name: out
param.label: out
param.help: Output classified image (each pixel contains the index of its corresponding vector in the SOM).

param.name: vm
param.label: vm
param.help: Validity mask (only pixels corresponding to a mask value greater than 0 will be used for learning)

param.name: tp
param.label: tp
param.help: Probability for a sample to be selected in the training set

param.name: som
param.label: som
param.help: Output image containing the Self-Organizing Map

param.name: sx
param.label: sx
param.help: X size of the SOM map

param.name: sy
param.label: sy
param.help: Y size of the SOM map

param.name: nx
param.label: nx
param.help: X size of the initial neighborhood in the SOM map

param.name: ny
param.label: ny
param.help: Y size of the initial neighborhood in the SOM map

param.name: ni
param.label: ni
param.help: Number of iterations for SOM learning

param.name: rand
param.label: rand
param.help: Set specific seed. with integer value.

param.name: indem
param.label: indem
param.help: The image should be either a projected DEM or a 3D grid containing 3D point coordinates and a validity mask.

param.name: map
param.label: map
param.help: Defines the map projection to be used.

param.name: map.utm.zone
param.label: map.utm.zone
param.help: The zone number ranges from 1 to 60 and allows defining the transverse mercator projection (along with the hemisphere)

param.name: map.utm.northhem
param.label: map.utm.northhem
param.help: The transverse mercator projections are defined by their zone number as well as the hemisphere. Activate this parameter if your image is in the northern hemisphere.

param.name: map.epsg.code
param.label: map.epsg.code
param.help: See www.spatialreference.org to find which EPSG code is associated to your projection

param.name: incolor
param.label: incolor
param.help: If the color image has 4 bands it will be interpreted as Red, Green, Blue, NIR. In other cases, only the first one is used (gray scale colors). The color values are expected in the range 0 - 255, and will be embedded with each 3D point of the PLY file.

param.name: io.inleft
param.label: io.inleft
param.help: The left image from the stereo pair, in sensor geometry.

param.name: io.inright
param.label: io.inright
param.help: The right image from the stereo pair, in sensor geometry.

param.name: io.outleft
param.label: io.outleft
param.help: The deformation grid to resample the left image from sensor geometry to epipolar geometry.

param.name: io.outright
param.label: io.outright
param.help: The deformation grid to resample the right image from sensor geometry to epipolar geometry.

param.name: epi.elevation.dem
param.label: epi.elevation.dem
param.help: This parameter allows selecting a directory containing Digital Elevation Model files. Note that this directory should contain only DEM files. Unexpected behaviour might occurs if other images are found in this directory.

param.name: epi.elevation.geoid
param.label: epi.elevation.geoid
param.help: Use a geoid grid to get the height above the ellipsoid in case there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles. A version of the geoid can be found on the OTB website(https://gitlab.orfeo-toolbox.org/orfeotoolbox/otb-data/blob/master/Input/DEM/egm96.grd).

param.name: epi.elevation.default
param.label: epi.elevation.default
param.help: This parameter allows setting the default height above ellipsoid when there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles, and no geoid file has been set. This is also used by some application as an average elevation value.

param.name: epi.elevation.avgdem.step
param.label: epi.elevation.avgdem.step
param.help: Step of sub-sampling for average elevation estimation

param.name: epi.scale
param.label: epi.scale
param.help: The scale parameter allows generating zoomed-in (scale < 1) or zoomed-out (scale > 1) epipolar images.

param.name: epi.step
param.label: epi.step
param.help: Stereo-rectification deformation grid only varies slowly. Therefore, it is recommended to use a coarser grid (higher step value) in case of large images

param.name: inverse.outleft
param.label: inverse.outleft
param.help: The deformation grid to resample the left image from the epipolar geometry back into its original sensor geometry.

param.name: inverse.outright
param.label: inverse.outright
param.help: The output deformation grid to resample the right image from the epipolar geometry back into its original sensor geometry.

param.name: inverse.ssrate
param.label: inverse.ssrate
param.help: Grid inversion is an heavy process that implies spline regression on control points. To avoid eating to much memory, this parameter allows one to first sub-sample the field to invert.

param.name: in
param.label: in
param.help: Raw Sentinel1 IW SLC image, or any extract of such made by OTB (geom file needed)

param.name: out
param.label: out
param.help: Deburst image, with updated geom file that can be further used by Orthorectification application. If the input image is a raw Sentinel1 product, uint16 output type should be used (encoding of S1 product). Otherwise, output type should match type of input image.

param.name: vec
param.label: vec
param.help: Vector data file containing samplingpositions. (OGR format)

param.name: outfield
param.label: outfield
param.help: Choice between naming method for output fields

param.name: outfield.prefix.name
param.label: outfield.prefix.name
param.help: Prefix used to form the field names thatwill contain the extracted values.

param.name: outfield.list.names
param.label: outfield.list.names
param.help: Full list of output field names.

param.name: field
param.label: field
param.help: Name of the field carrying the class name in the input vectors.

param.name: layer
param.label: layer
param.help: Layer index to read in the input vector file.

param.name: channel
param.label: channel
param.help: The selected channel index for input image

param.name: structype
param.label: structype
param.help: Choice of the structuring element type

param.name: radius
param.label: radius
param.help: Initial radius of the structuring element (in pixels)

param.name: step
param.label: step
param.help: Radius step along the profile (in pixels)

param.name: in
param.label: in
param.help: The input image can be any single or multiband image. Beware of pontential imbalance between bands ranges as it may alter euclidean distance.

param.name: fout
param.label: fout
param.help: This output image contains the final average spectral signatures of each pixel. The output type should be at least as wide as the input image type. Floating point encoding is advised. This output can be used as input image (in) of the LSMSSegmentation application [4,5].

param.name: foutpos
param.label: foutpos
param.help: This output image contains the 2D displacement between the input pixel spatial position and the final position after convergence. Floating point encoding is mandatory. This output can be used as input image (in) of the LSMSSegmentation application [4,5].

param.name: spatialr
param.label: spatialr
param.help: Radius of the spatial neighborhood for averaging. Higher values will result in more smoothing and higher processing time.

param.name: ranger
param.label: ranger
param.help: Threshold on spectral signature euclidean distance (expressed in radiometry unit) to consider neighborhood pixel for averaging. Higher values will be less edge-preserving (more similar to simple average in neighborhood), whereas lower values will result in less noise smoothing. Note that this parameter has no effect on processing time.

param.name: thres
param.label: thres
param.help: Algorithm will stop if update of average spectral signature and spatial position is below this threshold.

param.name: maxiter
param.label: maxiter
param.help: Algorithm will stop if convergence threshold is not met after the maximum number of iterations.

param.name: rangeramp
param.label: rangeramp
param.help: Vary the range radius linearly with the central pixel intensity (experimental).

param.name: modesearch
param.label: modesearch
param.help: If activated pixel iterative convergence is stopped if the path crosses an already converged pixel. Be careful, with this option, the result will slightly depend on thread number and the results will not be stable (see [4] for more details).

param.name: elev.dem
param.label: elev.dem

param.name: undecidedlabel
param.label: undecidedlabel
param.help: Label for the Undecided class. Pixels with more than 1 fused class are marked as Undecided. Please note that the Undecided value must be different from existing labels in the input classifications. By default, 'undecidedlabel = 0'.
