param.name: interpolator.bco.radius
param.label: interpolator.bco.radius
param.help: This allows setting the maximum amount of RAM available for processing. As the writing task is time consuming, it is better to write large pieces of data, which can be achieved by increasing this parameter (pay attention to your system capabilities)

param.name: out
param.label: out
param.help: Output calibrated image. This image contains the backscatter (sigmaNought) of the input image.

param.name: noise
param.label: noise
param.help: Flag to disable noise. For 5.2.0 release, the noise values are only read by TerraSARX product.

param.name: lut
param.label: lut
param.help: Lookup table values are not available with all SAR products. Products that provide lookup table with metadata are: Sentinel1, Radarsat2.

param.name: type.mean.radius
param.label: type.mean.radius
param.help: Standard deviation of the gaussian kernel used to filter the image

param.name: type.anidif.timestep
param.label: type.anidif.timestep
param.help: Time step that will be used to discretize the diffusion equation

param.name: type.anidif.nbiter
param.label: type.anidif.nbiter
param.help: Number of iterations needed to get the result

param.name: type.anidif.conductance
param.label: type.anidif.conductance
param.help: Controls the sensitivity of the conductance term in the diffusion equation. The lower it is the stronger the features will be preserved

param.name: il
param.label: il
param.help: Input images to concatenate (in lexicographic order, for instance : (0,0) (1,0) (0,1) (1,1)).

param.name: cols
param.label: cols
param.help: Number of columns in the tile array

param.name: rows
param.label: rows
param.help: Number of rows in the tile array

param.name: op
param.label: op
param.help: Selection of the operation to execute (default is : label to color).

param.name: op.colortolabel.notfound
param.label: op.colortolabel.notfound
param.help: Label to use for unknown colors.

param.name: method
param.label: method
param.help: Selection of color mapping methods and their parameters.

param.name: method.custom.lut
param.label: method.custom.lut
param.help: An ASCII file containing the look-up tablewith one color per line(for instance the line '1 255 0 0' means that all pixels with label 1 will be replaced by RGB color 255 0 0)Lines beginning with a # are ignored

param.name: method.continuous.min
param.label: method.continuous.min
param.help: Set the lower input value of the mapping range.

param.name: method.continuous.max
param.label: method.continuous.max
param.help: Set the higher input value of the mapping range.

param.name: method.image.in
param.label: method.image.in
param.help: Support image filename. For each label, the LUT is calculated from the mean pixel value in the support image, over the corresponding labeled areas. First of all, the support image is normalized with extrema rejection

param.name: method.image.nodatavalue
param.label: method.image.nodatavalue
param.help: NoData value for each channel of the support image, which will not be handled in the LUT estimation. If NOT checked, ALL the pixel values of the support image will be handled in the LUT estimation.

param.name: inm
param.label: inm
param.help: The image to reproject into the geometry of the reference input.

param.name: elev.dem
param.label: elev.dem
param.help: This parameter allows selecting a directory containing Digital Elevation Model files. Note that this directory should contain only DEM files. Unexpected behaviour might occurs if other images are found in this directory.

param.name: elev.geoid
param.label: elev.geoid
param.help: Use a geoid grid to get the height above the ellipsoid in case there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles. A version of the geoid can be found on the OTB website(https://gitlab.orfeo-toolbox.org/orfeotoolbox/otb-data/blob/master/Input/DEM/egm96.grd).

param.name: elev.default
param.label: elev.default
param.help: This parameter allows setting the default height above ellipsoid when there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles, and no geoid file has been set. This is also used by some application as an average elevation value.

param.name: lms
param.label: lms
param.help: Generate a coarser deformation field with the given spacing

param.name: fv
param.label: fv
param.help: Fill value for area outside the reprojected image

param.name: interpolator
param.label: interpolator
param.help: This group of parameters allows defining how the input image will be interpolated during resampling.

param.name: io.in
param.label: io.in
param.help: The input labeled image to regularize.

param.name: ip.radius
param.label: ip.radius
param.help: The radius of the ball shaped structuring element (expressed in pixels). By default, 'ip.radius = 1 pixel'.

param.name: ip.suvbool
param.label: ip.suvbool
param.help: Pixels with more than 1 majority class are marked as Undecided if this parameter is checked (true), or keep their Original labels otherwise (false). Please note that the Undecided value must be different from existing labels in the input labeled image. By default, 'ip.suvbool = false'.

param.name: ip.nodatalabel
param.label: ip.nodatalabel
param.help: Label for the NoData class. Such input pixels keep their NoData label in the output image. By default, 'ip.nodatalabel = 0'.

param.name: ip.undecidedlabel
param.label: ip.undecidedlabel
param.help: Label for the Undecided class. By default, 'ip.undecidedlabel = 0'.

param.name: ip.onlyisolatedpixels
param.label: ip.onlyisolatedpixels
param.help: Only pixels whose label is unique in the neighbordhood will be processed. By default, 'ip.onlyisolatedpixels = false'.

param.name: ip.isolatedthreshold
param.label: ip.isolatedthreshold
param.help: Maximum number of neighbours with the same label as the center pixel to consider that it is an isolated pixel. By default, 'ip.isolatedthreshold = 1'.

param.name: mask
param.label: mask
param.help: Optional mask to indicate which pixels are valid for computing the histogram quantiles. Pixels where the mask is zero will not contribute to the histogram. The mask must have the same dimensions as the input image.

param.name: quantile.high
param.label: quantile.high
param.help: Quantiles to cut from histogram high values before computing min/max rescaling (in percent, 2 by default)

param.name: quantile.low
param.label: quantile.low
param.help: Quantiles to cut from histogram low values before computing min/max rescaling (in percent, 2 by default)

param.name: channels
param.label: channels
param.help: It's possible to select the channels of the output image. There are 3 modes, the available choices are:

param.name: outmin
param.label: outmin
param.help: Minimum value of the output image.

param.name: outmax
param.label: outmax
param.help: Maximum value of the output image.

param.name: outmin
param.label: outmin
param.help: Minimum value of the output image.

param.name: outmax
param.label: outmax
param.help: Maximum value of the output image.

param.name: rox
param.label: rox
param.help: first point of ROI in x-direction

param.name: roy
param.label: roy
param.help: first point of ROI in y-direction

param.name: sx
param.label: sx
param.help: quicklook size in x-direction (used if no sampling ration is given)

param.name: sy
param.label: sy
param.help: quicklook size in y-direction (used if no sampling ration is given)

param.name: list
param.label: list
param.help: List of available radiometric indices with their relevant channels in brackets: Vegetation:NDVI - Normalized difference vegetation index (Red, NIR) Vegetation:TNDVI - Transformed normalized difference vegetation index (Red, NIR) Vegetation:RVI - Ratio vegetation index (Red, NIR) Vegetation:SAVI - Soil adjusted vegetation index (Red, NIR) Vegetation:TSAVI - Transformed soil adjusted vegetation index (Red, NIR) Vegetation:MSAVI - Modified soil adjusted vegetation index (Red, NIR) Vegetation:MSAVI2 - Modified soil adjusted vegetation index 2 (Red, NIR) Vegetation:GEMI - Global environment monitoring index (Red, NIR) Vegetation:IPVI - Infrared percentage vegetation index (Red, NIR) Water:NDWI - Normalized difference water index (Gao 1996) (NIR, MIR) Water:NDWI2 - Normalized difference water index (Mc Feeters 1996) (Green, NIR) Water:MNDWI - Modified normalized difference water index (Xu 2006) (Green, MIR) Water:NDPI - Normalized difference pond index (Lacaux et al.) (MIR, Green) Water:NDTI - Normalized difference turbidity index (Lacaux et al.) (Red, Green) Soil:RI - Redness index (Red, Green) Soil:CI - Color index (Red, Green) Soil:BI - Brightness index (Red, Green) Soil:BI2 - Brightness index 2 (NIR, Red, Green)

param.name: out
param.label: out
param.help: Region of interest from the input image

param.name: mode.fit.im
param.label: mode.fit.im
param.help: Reference image to define the ROI

param.name: mode.fit.vect
param.label: mode.fit.vect
param.help: The extent of the input vector file is computed and then gives a region of interest that will be extracted.

param.name: mode.extent.ulx
param.label: mode.extent.ulx
param.help: X coordinate of upper left corner point.

param.name: mode.extent.uly
param.label: mode.extent.uly
param.help: Y coordinate of upper left corner point.

param.name: mode.extent.lrx
param.label: mode.extent.lrx
param.help: X coordinate of lower right corner point.

param.name: mode.extent.lry
param.label: mode.extent.lry
param.help: Y coordinate of lower right corner point.

param.name: mode.radius.r
param.label: mode.radius.r
param.help: This is the radius parameter of the radius mode.

param.name: mode.radius.cx
param.label: mode.radius.cx
param.help: This is the center coordinate of the radius mode, it will be either an ordinate or a latitude.

param.name: cl
param.label: cl
param.help: Channels to write in the output image.

param.name: elev.dem
param.label: elev.dem
param.help: This parameter allows selecting a directory containing Digital Elevation Model files. Note that this directory should contain only DEM files. Unexpected behaviour might occurs if other images are found in this directory.

param.name: elev.geoid
param.label: elev.geoid
param.help: Use a geoid grid to get the height above the ellipsoid in case there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles. A version of the geoid can be found on the OTB website(https://gitlab.orfeo-toolbox.org/orfeotoolbox/otb-data/blob/master/Input/DEM/egm96.grd).

param.name: elev.default
param.label: elev.default
param.help: This parameter allows setting the default height above ellipsoid when there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles, and no geoid file has been set. This is also used by some application as an average elevation value.

param.name: in
param.label: in
param.help: Support image that will be classified

param.name: mask
param.label: mask
param.help: Validity mask (only pixels corresponding to a mask value greater than 0 will be used for statistics)

param.name: field
param.label: field
param.help: Name of the field carrying the class name in the input vectors.

param.name: layer
param.label: layer
param.help: Layer index to read in the input vector file.

param.name: elev.dem
param.label: elev.dem
param.help: This parameter allows selecting a directory containing Digital Elevation Model files. Note that this directory should contain only DEM files. Unexpected behaviour might occurs if other images are found in this directory.

param.name: elev.geoid
param.label: elev.geoid
param.help: Use a geoid grid to get the height above the ellipsoid in case there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles. A version of the geoid can be found on the OTB website(https://gitlab.orfeo-toolbox.org/orfeotoolbox/otb-data/blob/master/Input/DEM/egm96.grd).

param.name: elev.default
param.label: elev.default
param.help: This parameter allows setting the default height above ellipsoid when there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles, and no geoid file has been set. This is also used by some application as an average elevation value.

param.name: in
param.label: in
param.help: Input geo-referenced DEM to convert to general raster format.

param.name: out
param.label: out
param.help: will be used to get the prefix and the extension of the images to write

param.name: level
param.label: level
param.help: Number of levels in the pyramid (default is 1).

param.name: sfactor
param.label: sfactor
param.help: Subsampling factor between each level of the pyramid (default is 2).

param.name: vfactor
param.label: vfactor
param.help: Variance factor use in smoothing. It is multiplied by the subsampling factor of each level in the pyramid (default is 0.6).

param.name: fast
param.label: fast
param.help: If used, this option allows one to speed-up computation by iteratively subsampling previous level of pyramid instead of processing the full input.

param.name: in
param.label: in
param.help: The filtered image, corresponding to the fout output parameter of the MeanShiftSmoothing application.

param.name: inpos
param.label: inpos
param.help: The filtered position image, corresponding to the foutpos output parameter of the MeanShiftSmoothing application.

param.name: out
param.label: out
param.help: This output contains the segmented image, where each pixel value is the unique integer label of the segment it belongs to. It is recommended to set the pixel type to uint32.

param.name: spatialr
param.label: spatialr
param.help: Threshold on Spatial distance to consider pixels in the same segment. A good value is half the spatial radius used in the MeanShiftSmoothing application (spatialr parameter).

param.name: ranger
param.label: ranger
param.help: Threshold on spectral signature euclidean distance (expressed in radiometry unit) to consider pixels in the same segment. A good value is half the range radius used in the MeanShiftSmoothing application (ranger parameter).

param.name: minsize
param.label: minsize
param.help: Minimum Segment Size. If, after the segmentation, a segment is of size lower than this criterion, the segment is discarded.

param.name: tilesizex
param.label: tilesizex
param.help: Size of tiles along the X-axis for tile-wise processing.

param.name: tilesizey
param.label: tilesizey
param.help: Size of tiles along the Y-axis for tile-wise processing.

param.name: tmpdir
param.label: tmpdir
param.help: This applications need to write temporary files for each tile. This parameter allows choosing the path where to write those files. If disabled, the current path will be used.

param.name: cleanup
param.label: cleanup
param.help: If activated, the application will try to remove all temporary files it created.

param.name: filter.lee.nblooks
param.label: filter.lee.nblooks
param.help: Number of looks in the input image.

param.name: filter.frost.deramp
param.label: filter.frost.deramp
param.help: factor use to control theexponential function used to weight effect of the distance between thecentral pixel and its neighborhood. Increasing the deramp parameter willlead to take more into account pixels farther from the center andtherefore increase the smoothing effects.

param.name: filter.gammamap.nblooks
param.label: filter.gammamap.nblooks
param.help: Number of looks in the input image.

param.name: filter.kuan.nblooks
param.label: filter.kuan.nblooks
param.help: Number of looks in the input image.

param.name: io.vd
param.label: io.vd
param.help: Input geometries used for training (note : all geometries from the layer will be used)

param.name: io.stats
param.label: io.stats
param.help: XML file containing mean and variance of each feature.

param.name: layer
param.label: layer
param.help: Index of the layer to use in the input vector file.

param.name: feat
param.label: feat
param.help: List of field names in the input vector data to be used as features for training.

param.name: valid.vd
param.label: valid.vd
param.help: Geometries used for validation (must contain the same fields used for training, all geometries from the layer will be used)

param.name: valid.layer
param.label: valid.layer
param.help: Index of the layer to use in the validation vector file.

param.name: cfield
param.label: cfield
param.help: Field containing the class id for supervision. The values in this field shall be cast into integers. Only geometries with this field available will be taken into account.

param.name: v
param.label: v
param.help: Verbose mode, display the contingency table result.

param.name: classifier
param.label: classifier
param.help: Choice of the classifier to use for the training.

param.name: classifier.libsvm.c
param.label: classifier.libsvm.c
param.help: SVM models have a cost parameter C (1 by default) to control the trade-off between training errors and forcing rigid margins.

param.name: classifier.libsvm.nu
param.label: classifier.libsvm.nu
param.help: Cost parameter Nu, in the range 0..1, the larger the value, the smoother the decision.

param.name: classifier.boost.r
param.label: classifier.boost.r
param.help: A threshold between 0 and 1 used to save computational time. Samples with summary weight <= (1 - weight_trim_rate) do not participate in the next iteration of training. Set this parameter to 0 to turn off this functionality.

param.name: classifier.dt.max
param.label: classifier.dt.max
param.help: The training algorithm attempts to split each node while its depth is smaller than the maximum possible depth of the tree. The actual depth may be smaller if the other termination criteria are met, and/or if the tree is pruned.

param.name: classifier.dt.min
param.label: classifier.dt.min
param.help: If the number of samples in a node is smaller than this parameter, then this node will not be split.

param.name: classifier.dt.ra
param.label: classifier.dt.ra
param.help: If all absolute differences between an estimated value in a node and the values of the train samples in this node are smaller than this regression accuracy parameter, then the node will not be split further.

param.name: classifier.dt.cat
param.label: classifier.dt.cat
param.help: Cluster possible values of a categorical variable into K <= cat clusters to find a suboptimal split.

param.name: classifier.dt.f
param.label: classifier.dt.f
param.help: If cv_folds > 1, then it prunes a tree with K-fold cross-validation where K is equal to cv_folds.

param.name: classifier.dt.r
param.label: classifier.dt.r
param.help: If true, then a pruning will be harsher. This will make a tree more compact and more resistant to the training data noise but a bit less accurate.

param.name: classifier.dt.t
param.label: classifier.dt.t
param.help: If true, then pruned branches are physically removed from the tree.

param.name: classifier.ann.t
param.label: classifier.ann.t
param.help: Type of training method for the multilayer perceptron (MLP) neural network.

param.name: classifier.ann.sizes
param.label: classifier.ann.sizes
param.help: The number of neurons in each intermediate layer (excluding input and output layers).

param.name: classifier.ann.f
param.label: classifier.ann.f
param.help: This function determine whether the output of the node is positive or not depending on the output of the transfert function.

param.name: classifier.ann.a
param.label: classifier.ann.a
param.help: Alpha parameter of the activation function (used only with sigmoid and gaussian functions).

param.name: classifier.ann.b
param.label: classifier.ann.b
param.help: Beta parameter of the activation function (used only with sigmoid and gaussian functions).

param.name: classifier.ann.bpdw
param.label: classifier.ann.bpdw
param.help: Strength of the weight gradient term in the BACKPROP method. The recommended value is about 0.1.

param.name: classifier.ann.bpms
param.label: classifier.ann.bpms
param.help: Strength of the momentum term (the difference between weights on the 2 previous iterations). This parameter provides some inertia to smooth the random fluctuations of the weights. It can vary from 0 (the feature is disabled) to 1 and beyond. The value 0.1 or so is good enough.

param.name: classifier.ann.rdw
param.label: classifier.ann.rdw
param.help: Initial value Delta_0 of update-values Delta_

param.name: classifier.ann.eps
param.label: classifier.ann.eps
param.help: Epsilon value used in the Termination criteria.

param.name: classifier.ann.iter
param.label: classifier.ann.iter
param.help: Maximum number of iterations used in the Termination criteria.

param.name: classifier.rf.max
param.label: classifier.rf.max
param.help: The depth of the tree. A low value will likely underfit and conversely a high value will likely overfit. The optimal value can be obtained using cross validation or other suitable methods.

param.name: classifier.rf.min
param.label: classifier.rf.min
param.help: If the number of samples in a node is smaller than this parameter, then the node will not be split. A reasonable value is a small percentage of the total data e.g. 1 percent.

param.name: classifier.rf.ra
param.label: classifier.rf.ra
param.help: If all absolute differences between an estimated value in a node and the values of the train samples in this node are smaller than this regression accuracy parameter, then the node will not be split.

param.name: classifier.rf.cat
param.label: classifier.rf.cat
param.help: Cluster possible values of a categorical variable into K <= cat clusters to find a suboptimal split.

param.name: classifier.rf.var
param.label: classifier.rf.var
param.help: The size of the subset of features, randomly selected at each tree node, that are used to find the best split(s). If you set it to 0, then the size will be set to the square root of the total number of features.

param.name: classifier.rf.nbtrees
param.label: classifier.rf.nbtrees
param.help: The maximum number of trees in the forest. Typically, the more trees you have, the better the accuracy. However, the improvement in accuracy generally diminishes and reaches an asymptote for a certain number of trees. Also to keep in mind, increasing the number of trees increases the prediction time linearly.

param.name: classifier.knn.k
param.label: classifier.knn.k
param.help: The number of neighbors to use.

param.name: rand
param.label: rand
param.help: Set specific seed. with integer value.

param.name: in
param.label: in
param.help: Support image that will be classified

param.name: mask
param.label: mask
param.help: Validity mask (only pixels corresponding to a mask value greater than 0 will be used for statistics)

param.name: sampler
param.label: sampler
param.help: Type of sampling (periodic, pattern based, random)

param.name: sampler.periodic.jitter
param.label: sampler.periodic.jitter
param.help: Jitter amplitude added during sample selection (0 = no jitter)

param.name: strategy.byclass.in
param.label: strategy.byclass.in
param.help: Number of samples by class (CSV format with class name in 1st column and required samples in the 2nd.

param.name: strategy.constant.nb
param.label: strategy.constant.nb
param.help: Number of samples for all classes

param.name: strategy.total.v
param.label: strategy.total.v
param.help: The number of samples to generate

param.name: field
param.label: field
param.help: Name of the field carrying the class name in the input vectors.

param.name: layer
param.label: layer
param.help: Layer index to read in the input vector file.

param.name: elev.dem
param.label: elev.dem
param.help: This parameter allows selecting a directory containing Digital Elevation Model files. Note that this directory should contain only DEM files. Unexpected behaviour might occurs if other images are found in this directory.

param.name: elev.geoid
param.label: elev.geoid
param.help: Use a geoid grid to get the height above the ellipsoid in case there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles. A version of the geoid can be found on the OTB website(https://gitlab.orfeo-toolbox.org/orfeotoolbox/otb-data/blob/master/Input/DEM/egm96.grd).

param.name: elev.default
param.label: elev.default
param.help: This parameter allows setting the default height above ellipsoid when there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles, and no geoid file has been set. This is also used by some application as an average elevation value.

param.name: rand
param.label: rand
param.help: Set specific seed. with integer value.

param.name: ref.in
param.label: ref.in
param.help: Image used as reference in the comparison

param.name: ref.channel
param.label: ref.channel
param.help: Used channel for the reference image

param.name: meas.in
param.label: meas.in
param.help: Image used as measured in the comparison

param.name: meas.channel
param.label: meas.channel
param.help: Used channel for the measured image

param.name: ne
param.label: ne
param.help: The number of endmembers to extract from the hyperspectral image.

param.name: outendm
param.label: outendm
param.help: Endmembers, stored in aone-line multi-spectral image.Each pixel corresponds to oneendmembers and each band values corresponds to the spectralsignature of the corresponding endmember.

param.name: rand
param.label: rand
param.help: Set specific seed. with integer value.

param.name: out
param.label: out
param.help: The output filename will be used to get the prefix an the extension of the output written's image. For example with outimage.tif as output filename, the generated images will had an indice (corresponding at each bands) between the prefix and the extension, such as: outimage_0.tif and outimage_1.tif (if 2 bands).

param.name: il
param.label: il
param.help: List of images on which you want to determine corresponding SRTM tiles.

param.name: vl
param.label: vl
param.help: List of vector data files on which you want to determine corresponding SRTM tiles.

param.name: names
param.label: names
param.help: List of SRTM tile names to download. This list is added to the tiles derived from input images or vectors.The names should follow the SRTM tile naming convention, for instance N43E001.

param.name: tiledir
param.label: tiledir
param.help: Directory where SRTM tiles are stored. In download mode, the zipped archives will be downloaded to this directory. You'll need to unzip all tile files before using them in your application. In any case, this directory will be inspected to check which tiles are already downloaded.

param.name: feat
param.label: feat
param.help: List of features to consider for statistics.

param.name: in
param.label: in
param.help: The input image, containing initial spectral signatures corresponding to the segmented image (inseg).

param.name: inseg
param.label: inseg
param.help: Segmented image where each pixel value is the unique integer label of the segment it belongs to.

param.name: out
param.label: out
param.help: The output image. The output image is the segmented image where the minimal segments have been merged. An ecoding of uint32 is advised.

param.name: minsize
param.label: minsize
param.help: Minimum Segment Size. If, after the segmentation, a segment is of size lower than this criterion, the segment is merged with the segment that has the closest sepctral signature.

param.name: tilesizex
param.label: tilesizex
param.help: Size of tiles along the X-axis for tile-wise processing.

param.name: tilesizey
param.label: tilesizey
param.help: Size of tiles along the Y-axis for tile-wise processing.

param.name: coordx
param.label: coordx
param.help: This will be the X coordinate interpreted depending on the chosen mode

param.name: coordy
param.label: coordy
param.help: This will be the Y coordinate interpreted depending on the chosen mode

param.name: mode
param.label: mode
param.help: Different modes can be selected, default mode is Index.

param.name: mode.epsg.code
param.label: mode.epsg.code
param.help: This code is used to define a geographical coordinate system. If no system is specified, WGS84 (EPSG : 4326) is used by default.

param.name: in
param.label: in
param.help: The input image to be classified.

param.name: out
param.label: out
param.help: The output classified image with 3 different values (0 : Flat, 1 : Convex, 2 : Concave)

param.name: channel
param.label: channel
param.help: The selected channel index for input image

param.name: structype
param.label: structype
param.help: Choice of the structuring element type

param.name: radius
param.label: radius
param.help: Radius of the structuring element (in pixels), default value is 5.

param.name: sigma
param.label: sigma
param.help: Sigma value for leveling tolerance, default value is 0.5.

param.name: in
param.label: in
param.help: The input image can be any single or multiband image. Beware of pontential imbalance between bands ranges as it may alter euclidean distance.

param.name: spatialr
param.label: spatialr
param.help: Radius of the spatial neighborhood for averaging. Higher values will result in more smoothing and higher processing time.

param.name: ranger
param.label: ranger
param.help: Threshold on spectral signature euclidean distance (expressed in radiometry unit) to consider neighborhood pixel for averaging. Higher values will be less edge-preserving (more similar to simple average in neighborhood), whereas lower values will result in less noise smoothing. Note that this parameter has no effect on processing time.

param.name: minsize
param.label: minsize
param.help: Minimum Segment Size. If, after the segmentation, a segment is of size lower than this criterion, the segment is merged with the segment that has the closest sepctral signature.

param.name: tilesizex
param.label: tilesizex
param.help: Size of tiles along the X-axis for tile-wise processing.

param.name: tilesizey
param.label: tilesizey
param.help: Size of tiles along the Y-axis for tile-wise processing.

param.name: mode.vector.imfield
param.label: mode.vector.imfield
param.help: This is an optional support image that can be used to compute field values in each region. Otherwise, the input image is used as support.

param.name: mode.raster.out
param.label: mode.raster.out
param.help: It corresponds to the output of the small region merging step.

param.name: cleanup
param.label: cleanup
param.help: If activated, the application will try to clean all temporary files it created

param.name: io.il
param.label: io.il
param.help: A list of input images. First (n-1) bands should contain the predictor. The last band should contain the output value to predict.

param.name: io.csv
param.label: io.csv
param.help: Input CSV file containing the predictors, and the output values in last column. Only used when no input image is given

param.name: io.imstat
param.label: io.imstat
param.help: Input XML file containing the mean and the standard deviation of the input images.

param.name: sample.mt
param.label: sample.mt
param.help: Maximum number of training predictors (default = 1000) (no limit = -1).

param.name: sample.mv
param.label: sample.mv
param.help: Maximum number of validation predictors (default = 1000) (no limit = -1).

param.name: sample.vtr
param.label: sample.vtr
param.help: Ratio between training and validation samples (0.0 = all training, 1.0 = all validation) (default = 0.5).

param.name: classifier
param.label: classifier
param.help: Choice of the classifier to use for the training.

param.name: classifier.libsvm.c
param.label: classifier.libsvm.c
param.help: SVM models have a cost parameter C (1 by default) to control the trade-off between training errors and forcing rigid margins.

param.name: classifier.libsvm.nu
param.label: classifier.libsvm.nu
param.help: Cost parameter Nu, in the range 0..1, the larger the value, the smoother the decision.

param.name: classifier.libsvm.eps
param.label: classifier.libsvm.eps
param.help: The distance between feature vectors from the training set and the fitting hyper-plane must be less than Epsilon. For outliersthe penalty mutliplier is set by C.

param.name: classifier.dt.max
param.label: classifier.dt.max
param.help: The training algorithm attempts to split each node while its depth is smaller than the maximum possible depth of the tree. The actual depth may be smaller if the other termination criteria are met, and/or if the tree is pruned.

param.name: classifier.dt.min
param.label: classifier.dt.min
param.help: If the number of samples in a node is smaller than this parameter, then this node will not be split.

param.name: classifier.dt.ra
param.label: classifier.dt.ra
param.help: If all absolute differences between an estimated value in a node and the values of the train samples in this node are smaller than this regression accuracy parameter, then the node will not be split further.

param.name: classifier.dt.cat
param.label: classifier.dt.cat
param.help: Cluster possible values of a categorical variable into K <= cat clusters to find a suboptimal split.

param.name: classifier.dt.f
param.label: classifier.dt.f
param.help: If cv_folds > 1, then it prunes a tree with K-fold cross-validation where K is equal to cv_folds.

param.name: classifier.dt.r
param.label: classifier.dt.r
param.help: If true, then a pruning will be harsher. This will make a tree more compact and more resistant to the training data noise but a bit less accurate.

param.name: classifier.dt.t
param.label: classifier.dt.t
param.help: If true, then pruned branches are physically removed from the tree.

param.name: classifier.ann.t
param.label: classifier.ann.t
param.help: Type of training method for the multilayer perceptron (MLP) neural network.

param.name: classifier.ann.sizes
param.label: classifier.ann.sizes
param.help: The number of neurons in each intermediate layer (excluding input and output layers).

param.name: classifier.ann.f
param.label: classifier.ann.f
param.help: This function determine whether the output of the node is positive or not depending on the output of the transfert function.

param.name: classifier.ann.a
param.label: classifier.ann.a
param.help: Alpha parameter of the activation function (used only with sigmoid and gaussian functions).

param.name: classifier.ann.b
param.label: classifier.ann.b
param.help: Beta parameter of the activation function (used only with sigmoid and gaussian functions).

param.name: classifier.ann.bpdw
param.label: classifier.ann.bpdw
param.help: Strength of the weight gradient term in the BACKPROP method. The recommended value is about 0.1.

param.name: classifier.ann.bpms
param.label: classifier.ann.bpms
param.help: Strength of the momentum term (the difference between weights on the 2 previous iterations). This parameter provides some inertia to smooth the random fluctuations of the weights. It can vary from 0 (the feature is disabled) to 1 and beyond. The value 0.1 or so is good enough.

param.name: classifier.ann.rdw
param.label: classifier.ann.rdw
param.help: Initial value Delta_0 of update-values Delta_

param.name: classifier.ann.eps
param.label: classifier.ann.eps
param.help: Epsilon value used in the Termination criteria.

param.name: classifier.ann.iter
param.label: classifier.ann.iter
param.help: Maximum number of iterations used in the Termination criteria.

param.name: classifier.rf.max
param.label: classifier.rf.max
param.help: The depth of the tree. A low value will likely underfit and conversely a high value will likely overfit. The optimal value can be obtained using cross validation or other suitable methods.

param.name: classifier.rf.min
param.label: classifier.rf.min
param.help: If the number of samples in a node is smaller than this parameter, then the node will not be split. A reasonable value is a small percentage of the total data e.g. 1 percent.

param.name: classifier.rf.ra
param.label: classifier.rf.ra
param.help: If all absolute differences between an estimated value in a node and the values of the train samples in this node are smaller than this regression accuracy parameter, then the node will not be split.

param.name: classifier.rf.cat
param.label: classifier.rf.cat
param.help: Cluster possible values of a categorical variable into K <= cat clusters to find a suboptimal split.

param.name: classifier.rf.var
param.label: classifier.rf.var
param.help: The size of the subset of features, randomly selected at each tree node, that are used to find the best split(s). If you set it to 0, then the size will be set to the square root of the total number of features.

param.name: classifier.rf.nbtrees
param.label: classifier.rf.nbtrees
param.help: The maximum number of trees in the forest. Typically, the more trees you have, the better the accuracy. However, the improvement in accuracy generally diminishes and reaches an asymptote for a certain number of trees. Also to keep in mind, increasing the number of trees increases the prediction time linearly.

param.name: classifier.knn.k
param.label: classifier.knn.k
param.help: The number of neighbors to use.

param.name: rand
param.label: rand
param.help: Set specific seed. with integer value.

param.name: bins
param.label: bins
param.help: Number of bins in the histogram

param.name: hfact
param.label: hfact
param.help: This parameter will set the maximum height accepted in a bin on the input image histogram. The maximum height will be computed as hfact*eqHeight where eqHeight is the height of the theoretical flat histogram. The higher hfact, the higher the contrast.When using 'luminance mode', it is recommended to limit this factor to a small value (ex: 4)

param.name: nodata
param.label: nodata
param.help: If there is a value in the image that has no visualization meaning, it can be ignored by the algorithm.

param.name: spatial.local.h
param.label: spatial.local.h
param.help: Height of the thumbnail over which the histogram will be computed. The value is in pixels.

param.name: spatial.local.w
param.label: spatial.local.w
param.help: Width of the thumbnail over which the histogram will be computed. The value is in pixels.

param.name: minmax
param.label: minmax
param.help: Minimum and maximum value that will bound the histogram and thus the dynamic of the resulting image. Values over those boundaries will be clipped.

param.name: minmax.auto.global
param.label: minmax.auto.global
param.help: Min/max computation will result in the same minimum and maximum for all the bands.

param.name: in
param.label: in
param.help: The input image on which the features are computed.

param.name: out
param.label: out
param.help: Output image containing the edge features.

param.name: in.vd
param.label: in.vd
param.help: The input vector data to reproject

param.name: in.kwl
param.label: in.kwl
param.help: Optional input image to fill vector data with image kwl.

param.name: out.proj.image.in
param.label: out.proj.image.in
param.help: Projection map will be found using image metadata

param.name: out.proj.user.map
param.label: out.proj.user.map
param.help: Defines the map projection to be used.

param.name: out.proj.user.map.utm.zone
param.label: out.proj.user.map.utm.zone
param.help: The zone number ranges from 1 to 60 and allows defining the transverse mercator projection (along with the hemisphere)

param.name: out.proj.user.map.utm.northhem
param.label: out.proj.user.map.utm.northhem
param.help: The transverse mercator projections are defined by their zone number as well as the hemisphere. Activate this parameter if your image is in the northern hemisphere.

param.name: out.proj.user.map.epsg.code
param.label: out.proj.user.map.epsg.code
param.help: See www.spatialreference.org to find which EPSG code is associated to your projection

param.name: elev.dem
param.label: elev.dem
param.help: This parameter allows selecting a directory containing Digital Elevation Model files. Note that this directory should contain only DEM files. Unexpected behaviour might occurs if other images are found in this directory.

param.name: elev.geoid
param.label: elev.geoid
param.help: Use a geoid grid to get the height above the ellipsoid in case there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles. A version of the geoid can be found on the OTB website(https://gitlab.orfeo-toolbox.org/orfeotoolbox/otb-data/blob/master/Input/DEM/egm96.grd).

param.name: elev.default
param.label: elev.default
param.help: This parameter allows setting the default height above ellipsoid when there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles, and no geoid file has been set. This is also used by some application as an average elevation value.

param.name: modulus
param.label: modulus
param.help: Modulus of the input image computes with thefollowing formula: :math:`\sqrt

param.name: phase
param.label: phase
param.help: Phase of the input image computes with the following formula::math:`\tan^

param.name: in
param.label: in
param.help: Input image on which lines will be detected.

param.name: elev.dem
param.label: elev.dem
param.help: This parameter allows selecting a directory containing Digital Elevation Model files. Note that this directory should contain only DEM files. Unexpected behaviour might occurs if other images are found in this directory.

param.name: elev.geoid
param.label: elev.geoid
param.help: Use a geoid grid to get the height above the ellipsoid in case there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles. A version of the geoid can be found on the OTB website(https://gitlab.orfeo-toolbox.org/orfeotoolbox/otb-data/blob/master/Input/DEM/egm96.grd).

param.name: elev.default
param.label: elev.default
param.help: This parameter allows setting the default height above ellipsoid when there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles, and no geoid file has been set. This is also used by some application as an average elevation value.

param.name: norescale
param.label: norescale
param.help: By default, the input image amplitude is rescaled between [0,255]. Turn on this parameter to skip rescaling

param.name: in
param.label: in
param.help: The input image to compute the features on.

param.name: out
param.label: out
param.help: Output image containing the local statistical moments.

param.name: SPLIT
param.label: SPLIT
param.help: Set true if you want multipart polygons to become separate polygons.

param.name: FIELDS
param.label: FIELDS
param.help: Attributes to add. Select none to add all

param.name: SPLIT
param.label: SPLIT
param.help: Set true if you want multipart polygons to become separate polygons.

param.name: DOUBLE
param.label: DOUBLE
param.help: give output of an edge twice, i.e. once for each of the two adjacent polygons

param.name: SPLIT
param.label: SPLIT
param.help: Set true if you want multipart polygons to become separate polygons.

param.name: MERGE
param.label: MERGE
param.help: Merge Line Parts to One Polygon

param.name: SPLIT
param.label: SPLIT
param.help: Set true if you want multipart polygons to become separate polygons.

param.name: FIELDS
param.label: FIELDS
param.help: Select one or more attributes to be copied to the target layer.

param.name: SCALING
param.label: SCALING
param.help: Scaling factor for perimeter and area (squared). meter to feet = 1 / 0.3048 = 3.2808

param.name: SPLIT
param.label: SPLIT
param.help: Set true if you want multipart polygons to become separate polygons.

param.name: SPLIT
param.label: SPLIT
param.help: Set true if you want multipart polygons to become separate polygons.

param.name: FERET_DIRS
param.label: FERET_DIRS
param.help: Number of directions (0-90) to be analyzed.

param.name: GIVE_TIME
param.label: GIVE_TIME
param.help: Do you wish to provide the time stamp of Image?

param.name: TIME_DIFF
param.label: TIME_DIFF
param.help: Acceptable Time Difference between Image and Laser Points

param.name: GIVE_DISTORTIONS
param.label: GIVE_DISTORTIONS
param.help: Do you wish to provide the Radial Distortion Parameters?

param.name: RELEASE_AREAS
param.label: RELEASE_AREAS
param.help: Release areas encoded by unique integer IDs, all other cells NoData [-].

param.name: MATERIAL
param.label: MATERIAL
param.help: Height of material available in each start cell [m].

param.name: FRICTION_ANGLE_GRID
param.label: FRICTION_ANGLE_GRID
param.help: Spatially distributed friction angles [degree]. Optionally used with the Geometric Gradient, Fahrboeschung's angle or Shadow Angle friction model.

param.name: SLOPE_IMPACT_GRID
param.label: SLOPE_IMPACT_GRID
param.help: Slope impact grid, impact areas encoded with valid values, all other NoData. Optionally used with the Shadow Angle or the 1-parameter friction model.

param.name: FRICTION_MU_GRID
param.label: FRICTION_MU_GRID
param.help: Spatially distributed friction parameter mu [-], optionally used with the 1-parameter friction model or the PCM Model.

param.name: FRICTION_MASS_TO_DRAG_GRID
param.label: FRICTION_MASS_TO_DRAG_GRID
param.help: Spatially distributed mass to drag ratio [m], optionally used with the PCM Model.

param.name: RW_SLOPE_THRES
param.label: RW_SLOPE_THRES
param.help: In case the local slope is greater as this threshold [degree], no lateral spreading is modeled.

param.name: RW_EXPONENT
param.label: RW_EXPONENT
param.help: The exponent [-] is controlling the amount of lateral spreading in case the local slope is in between zero and the slope threshold.

param.name: RW_PERSISTENCE
param.label: RW_PERSISTENCE
param.help: Factor [-] used as weight for the current flow direction. A higher factor reduces abrupt changes in flow direction.

param.name: GPP_ITERATIONS
param.label: GPP_ITERATIONS
param.help: The number of model runs from each start cell [-].

param.name: GPP_SEED
param.label: GPP_SEED
param.help: The seed value used to initialize the pseudo-random number generator. A value of 1 will initialize the generator with the current time, higher numbers will always produce the same succession of values for each seed value [-].

param.name: FRICTION_THRES_FREE_FALL
param.label: FRICTION_THRES_FREE_FALL
param.help: The minimum slope angle [degree] between start cell and current cell for modeling free fall with the Shadow Angle or the 1-parameter friction model.

param.name: FRICTION_METHOD_IMPACT
param.label: FRICTION_METHOD_IMPACT
param.help: Choose the velocity calculation on slope impact with the 1-parameter friction model.

param.name: FRICTION_IMPACT_REDUCTION
param.label: FRICTION_IMPACT_REDUCTION
param.help: The energy reduction [%] on slope impact with the 1-parameter friction model.

param.name: FRICTION_ANGLE
param.label: FRICTION_ANGLE
param.help: Friction angle [degree] used as Geometric Gradient, Fahrboeschung's angle or Shadow Angle.

param.name: FRICTION_MU
param.label: FRICTION_MU
param.help: The (constant) friction parameter mu [-] used with the 1-parameter friction model or the PCM Model.

param.name: FRICTION_MODE_OF_MOTION
param.label: FRICTION_MODE_OF_MOTION
param.help: Choose the mode of motion on hillslope with the 1-parameter friction model.

param.name: FRICTION_MASS_TO_DRAG
param.label: FRICTION_MASS_TO_DRAG
param.help: The (constant) mass to drag ratio [m] used with the PCM Model.

param.name: FRICTION_INIT_VELOCITY
param.label: FRICTION_INIT_VELOCITY
param.help: The initial velocity [m/s] used with the PCM Model.

param.name: DEPOSITION_INITIAL
param.label: DEPOSITION_INITIAL
param.help: The percentage of available material (per run) initially deposited at the stopping position [%].

param.name: DEPOSITION_SLOPE_THRES
param.label: DEPOSITION_SLOPE_THRES
param.help: The slope angle below which the deposition of material is starting [degree].

param.name: DEPOSITION_VELOCITY_THRES
param.label: DEPOSITION_VELOCITY_THRES
param.help: The velocity below which the deposition of material is starting [m/s].

param.name: DEPOSITION_MAX
param.label: DEPOSITION_MAX
param.help: The percentage of available material (per run) which is deposited at most (slope or velocity equal zero) [%].

param.name: DEPOSITION_MIN_PATH
param.label: DEPOSITION_MIN_PATH
param.help: The minimum path length which has to be reached before material deposition is enabled [m].

param.name: SINK_MIN_SLOPE
param.label: SINK_MIN_SLOPE
param.help: The minimum slope to preserve on sink filling [degree].

param.name: NORMALISE
param.label: NORMALISE
param.help: Automatically normalise grids by standard deviation before clustering.

param.name: RANGE
param.label: RANGE
param.help: The number of preceding and following records to be taken into account for statistics. The total number is one plus two times the range.

param.name: VERBOSE
param.label: VERBOSE
param.help: output of intermediate results to execution message window

param.name: mRMR_DISCRETIZE
param.label: mRMR_DISCRETIZE
param.help: uncheck this means no discretizaton (i.e. data is already integer)

param.name: mRMR_THRESHOLD
param.label: mRMR_THRESHOLD
param.help: a double number of the discretization threshold; set to 0 to make binarization

param.name: FIELDS
param.label: FIELDS
param.help: If no field is selected statistics will be built from all numeric fields.

param.name: FIELDS
param.label: FIELDS
param.help: If no field is selected statistics will be built from all numeric fields.

param.name: FIELDS
param.label: FIELDS
param.help: The (numeric) fields to calculate the statistics for.

param.name: NFIRST
param.label: NFIRST
param.help: maximum number of calculated first components; set to zero to get all

param.name: NORMALISE
param.label: NORMALISE
param.help: Automatically normalise grids by standard deviation before clustering.

param.name: OUTPUT
param.label: OUTPUT

param.name: DOWN
param.label: DOWN
param.help: Choose if you want to segmentate either on minima or on maxima.

param.name: JOIN

param.name: THRESHOLD
param.label: THRESHOLD
param.help: Specify a threshold value as minimum difference between neighboured segments.

param.name: EDGE
param.label: EDGE
param.help: Allow Edge Pixels to be Seeds

param.name: BBORDERS
param.label: BBORDERS
param.help: Create borders between segments as new grid.

param.name: NORMALIZE

param.name: SIZE

param.name: ANN_LAYERS
param.label: ANN_LAYERS
param.help: You can specify the number of layers in the network (not including input and output layer).

param.name: ANN_NEURONS
param.label: ANN_NEURONS
param.help: You can specify the number of neurons in each layer of the network.

param.name: ANN_EPSILON
param.label: ANN_EPSILON
param.help: Termination criteria of the training algorithm. You can specify how much the error could change between the iterations to make the algorithm continue (epsilon).

param.name: DISP_MIN
param.label: DISP_MIN
param.help: Minimum possible disparity value. Normally, it is zero but sometimes rectification algorithms can shift images, so this parameter needs to be adjusted accordingly.

param.name: DISP_NUM
param.label: DISP_NUM
param.help: Maximum disparity minus minimum disparity. The value is always greater than zero.

param.name: BLOCKSIZE
param.label: BLOCKSIZE
param.help: The linear size of the blocks compared by the algorithm. Larger block size implies smoother, though less accurate disparity map. Smaller block size gives more detailed disparity map, but there is higher chance for algorithm to find a wrong correspondence.

param.name: DIFF_MAX
param.label: DIFF_MAX
param.help: Maximum allowed difference (in integer pixel units) in the left-right disparity check. Set it to a non-positive value to disable the check.

param.name: UNIQUENESS
param.label: UNIQUENESS
param.help: Margin in percentage by which the best (minimum) computed cost function value should "win" the second best value to consider the found match correct. Normally, a value within the 5-15 range is good enough.

param.name: SPECKLE_SIZE
param.label: SPECKLE_SIZE
param.help: Maximum size of smooth disparity regions to consider their noise speckles and invalidate. Set it to 0 to disable speckle filtering. Otherwise, set it somewhere in the 50-200 range.

param.name: SPECKLE_RANGE
param.label: SPECKLE_RANGE
param.help: Maximum disparity variation within each connected component. If you do speckle filtering, set the parameter to a positive value, it will be implicitly multiplied by 16. Normally, 1 or 2 is good enough.

param.name: BM_FILTER_CAP
param.label: BM_FILTER_CAP
param.help: Truncation value for the prefiltered image pixels.

param.name: SGBM_P1
param.label: SGBM_P1
param.help: The larger the value, the smoother the disparity. Parameter 1 is the penalty on the disparity change by plus or minus 1 between neighbor pixels. The algorithm requires Parameter 2 > Parameter 1.

param.name: SGBM_P2
param.label: SGBM_P2
param.help: The larger the value, the smoother the disparity. Parameter 2 is the penalty on the disparity change by more than 1 between neighbor pixels. The algorithm requires Parameter 2 > Parameter 1.

param.name: SGBM_FILTER_CAP
param.label: SGBM_FILTER_CAP
param.help: Truncation value for the prefiltered image pixels. The algorithm first computes x-derivative at each pixel and clips its value by [-preFilterCap, preFilterCap] interval. The result values are passed to the Birchfield-Tomasi pixel cost function.

param.name: RGB_COLORS
param.label: RGB_COLORS
param.help: Use the first three features in list to obtain blue, green, red components for class colour in look-up table.

param.name: MODEL_LOAD
param.label: MODEL_LOAD
param.help: Use a model previously stored to file.

param.name: TRAIN_BUFFER
param.label: TRAIN_BUFFER
param.help: For non-polygon type training areas, creates a buffer with a diameter of specified size.

param.name: MODEL_SAVE
param.label: MODEL_SAVE
param.help: Stores model to file to be used for subsequent classifications instead of training areas.

param.name: MAX_DEPTH
param.label: MAX_DEPTH
param.help: The maximum possible depth of the tree. That is the training algorithms attempts to split a node while its depth is less than maxDepth. The root node has zero depth.

param.name: MIN_SAMPLES
param.label: MIN_SAMPLES
param.help: If the number of samples in a node is less than this parameter then the node will not be split.

param.name: MAX_CATEGRS
param.label: MAX_CATEGRS
param.help: Cluster possible values of a categorical variable into K<=maxCategories clusters to find a suboptimal split.

param.name: 1SE_RULE
param.label: 1SE_RULE
param.help: If true then a pruning will be harsher. This will make a tree more compact and more resistant to the training data noise but a bit less accurate.

param.name: TRUNC_PRUNED
param.label: TRUNC_PRUNED
param.help: If true then pruned branches are physically removed from the tree. Otherwise they are retained and it is possible to get results from the original unpruned (or pruned less aggressively) tree.

param.name: REG_ACCURACY
param.label: REG_ACCURACY
param.help: Termination criteria for regression trees. If all absolute differences between an estimated value in a node and values of train samples in this node are less than this parameter then the node will not be split further.

param.name: ACTIVE_VARS
param.label: ACTIVE_VARS
param.help: The size of the randomly selected subset of features at each tree node and that are used to find the best split(s). If you set it to 0 then the size will be set to the square root of the total number of features.

param.name: W
param.label: W
param.help: The parameter weights the influence of catchment size on relative elevation (inversely proportional).

param.name: T
param.label: T
param.help: The parameter controls the amount by which a maximum in the neighbourhood of a cell is taken over into the cell (considering the local slope between the cells). The smaller 't' and/or the smaller the slope, the more of the maximum value is taken over into the cell. This results in a greater generalization/smoothing of the result. The greater 't' and/or the higher the slope, the less is taken over into the cell and the result will show a more irregular pattern caused by small changes in elevation between the cells.

param.name: E
param.label: E
param.help: The parameter controls the position of relative height maxima as a function of slope.

param.name: EPSILON
param.label: EPSILON
param.help: maximum difference between original and median filtered elevation (3x3 moving window) that still is recognized flat

param.name: DW_IDW_OFFSET

param.name: SINKROUTE
param.label: SINKROUTE
param.help: An optional grid that provides information about flow directions. <br/>Values between 1 to 8 force the flow of a cell to be given to one its adjacent neighbor cells (1->NE, 2->E, 3->SE, 4->S, 5->SW, 6->W, 7->NW, 8->N). In case of other values the algorithm will use its own routing scheme. <br/>This option is in particular useful to supply the algorithm with routes that lead the flow through closed depression.

param.name: INIT_GRID
param.label: INIT_GRID
param.help: Dependent on the chosen 'Initiation Type' and 'Initiation Threshold' the values of this grid control where a channel is initiated.

param.name: INIT_METHOD
param.label: INIT_METHOD
param.help: Options:<br/> - Less than<br/> - Equals<br/> - Greater than<br/>Controls under which condition a channel is initiated.

param.name: INIT_VALUE
